subject: Publish placement documents
messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:38:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

There's reason to believe this will work.

Discussing whether we should do this now, or later when more of the content is cleaned up."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Eric and I talked for an entire 11 minutes about this and decided to go for it: http://p.anticdent.org/22iY'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Summary of IRC discussion [1]:

- 1) Land this patch, which will publish to the location linked in the commit message, which a) won't conflict with existing placement documentation (which is published under nova/latest) and b) won't yet be linked from the main docs indices.
- 2) Continue polishing the openstack/placement content (see e.g. [2] and [3] for patches along these lines) until we're reasonably happy with it.
- also 2) Compose a patch in openstack/nova removing the placement content and/or redirecting to the new location.
- 3) Compose the openstack-manuals patch to start indexing the new location from the base docs pages (per [4]). We can make this Depends-On the nova patch in step 3. Or not. Probably doesn't matter.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2018-10-29.log.html#t2018-10-29T21:23:55
[2] https://review.openstack.org/612665
[3] https://review.openstack.org/613200
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/doc-index.html"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 15:07:39.000000000', 'message': 'Publish placement documents

Use publish-openstack-docs-pti job instead of
build-openstack-docs-pti job to publish placement documents
as https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/ .

Change-Id: I667387ec262680af899a628520c107fa0d4eec24
'}]
commit_message:
Publish placement documents

Use publish-openstack-docs-pti job instead of
build-openstack-docs-pti job to publish placement documents
as https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/ .

Change-Id: I667387ec262680af899a628520c107fa0d4eec24

commit_message:
Remove pywsman reference

As commented upon during an unrelated review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599051/4/ironic/tests/unit/drivers/third_party_driver_mocks.py

Removing the pywsman reference as the drac driver
migrated to dracclient.

Change-Id: I75637caa38deb723ef8b2fa2f4b897a02071da71

commit_message:
Change port and version on v3 endpoints example

On doc/source/api_curl_examples.rst the GET /v3/endpoints
example response section had http://localhost:35357/v2.0 but
API v2 was removed so it was modified to http://localhost:5000/v3.

Change-Id: Ic51c2d530296c9a92245b34b50fea5e82036d163

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 13:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'Summary should be a one liner

Without this change twine check dist/* would fail as this was
producing a double new line. The rest of the PKG-INFO would then
be interpreted as the message body and become the long
description. See https://github.com/pypa/twine/issues/422 for
more details.

This fixes the test-release-openstack-python3 zuul job.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If1330c4824e949aa427475dfcc26218fb398a66e
'}]
commit_message:
Summary should be a one liner

Without this change twine check dist/* would fail as this was
producing a double new line. The rest of the PKG-INFO would then
be interpreted as the message body and become the long
description. See https://github.com/pypa/twine/issues/422 for
more details.

This fixes the test-release-openstack-python3 zuul job.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If1330c4824e949aa427475dfcc26218fb398a66e

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I8b0bcd14640449db2d03f1a55d94b5d12e64c39d
Story: #2004073
Task: #27432

commit_message:
Remove openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master

This is a job that runs only on master and it stayed in project-config.
It should not have been imported here as part of python3-first topic,
remove it again.

Change-Id: Id1ddf79100d83f665b62b1ef73ed8689a2afd3bb

commit_message:
Fix DHCPv6 support

Adds logic to handle the appropriate replies for DHCPv6
responses.

The IPv6 nature was discovered while researching differences
and finding that the field ID value changes between IPv4 and
IPv6 DHCP clients, as DHCPv6 is purely booting from a URL.

Change-Id: I63572bea9bfb150aaeb4708dfa57e71adf4f64ab
Task: 9788
Story: 1744620
Story: 2003934

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-27 17:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve
performance by copying files directly on the destination instead of
creating intermediate ones first.

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2
(cherry picked from commit 592cb54d3c5b5251b421de290dbde6dbba5e6c61)
'}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve
performance by copying files directly on the destination instead of
creating intermediate ones first.

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2
(cherry picked from commit 592cb54d3c5b5251b421de290dbde6dbba5e6c61)

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-tripleo-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/72/418172/1/check/gate-tripleo-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/c2c79f6/ : FAILURE in 1m 42s
- gate-tripleo-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/72/418172/1/check/gate-tripleo-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/111138e/ : SUCCESS in 1m 42s'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2017-03-21 18:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-07-26 04:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please move it to queens.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2017-11-07 21:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is being shelved for now, but may be revisited in the future.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-10-29 07:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

seems like a good time to get going with that, as from fedora 29^ there is no network service'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-29 20:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Noam, while you are correct that there is no network service built in to F29, there is still an optional package which will restore network init-script functionality. This is good because at this time NetworkManager does not support all of the interface types that we require for OpenStack support (OVS bridges, OVS-DPDK, SR-IOV, 3rd-party interfaces like Contrail, etc.). Once NetworkManager has full support for all interface types, we are hoping to implement an API-driven interface to NM. We are looking at options for interacting with Network Manager via API, particularly nmstate and Ansible Networking. It is still possible that nmcli will be the best way to configure networking if not all interface types are supported via nmstate, but the nmstate developers are aiming to support any interface type supported by NetworkManager. So this change is being deferred while further research and development are happening.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-10-29 20:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Noam, while you are correct that there is no network service built
 > in to F29, there is still an optional package which will restore
 > network init-script functionality. This is good because at this
 > time NetworkManager does not support all of the interface types
 > that we require for OpenStack support (OVS bridges, OVS-DPDK,
 > SR-IOV, 3rd-party interfaces like Contrail, etc.). Once
 > NetworkManager has full support for all interface types, we are
 > hoping to implement an API-driven interface to NM. We are looking
 > at options for interacting with Network Manager via API,
 > particularly nmstate and Ansible Networking. It is still possible
 > that nmcli will be the best way to configure networking if not all
 > interface types are supported via nmstate, but the nmstate
 > developers are aiming to support any interface type supported by
 > NetworkManager. So this change is being deferred while further
 > research and development are happening.

Thanks for the detailed amswer. Could you tell what package?'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-29 20:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Noam, the package that provides the network scripts is "initscripts". It used to be included in the base distributions, but is now optional.'}]

commit_message:
Add spec: os-net-config-impl-nmcli (os-net-config NetworkManager CLI)

This spec describes the proposal to add support for the NetworkManager
CLI to os-net-config. This will allow network configuration for
Atomic hosts, since Atomic does not support traditional network
configuration files in /etc.

Change-Id: I4695d107eb946f61edc6ac7fac6980d7c90b8f7c

commit_message:
apparmor: Allow cgroup v2 mounts

Previously, only the v1 of the cgroup fs was being allowed by AppArmor
and this were causing problems like the following one

 audit: type=1400 audit(1540571957.300:196): apparmor="DENIED"
 operation="mount" info="failed type match" error=-13
 profile="lxc-container-default-cgns" name="/sys/fs/cgroup/unified/"
 pid=26738 comm="systemd" fstype="cgroup2" srcname="cgroup" flags="rw,
 nosuid, nodev, noexec"

Change-Id: I7f6ac8af0bc1c7d9844ee0c3505b65894d3b7aa1

commit_message:
Skip the services with no endpoints when parsing service catalog

When parsing the service catalog to find the source, audit middleware
should skip over the services which have no endpoints instead of
assuming they will have at least one endpoint.

Change-Id: I287873e99338d95baaf20d52ecb3a43763a401fc
Closes-Bug: #1800017

commit_message:
Add permanent ARP entries for DVR fip/qrouter veth pair

Since we know the IP and MAC addresses of both sides of the
fip/qrouter namespace veth pair device, just add permanent
ARP entries for them.

Change-Id: I6193b00681dfb79222eedfd00c89620321ac1b4f
Related-Bug: #1791989
(cherry picked from commit ac5815a110f0033c1a217481822fc0c72c1ba16c)

commit_message:
Add doc depends to tox releasenotes environment

When I run "tox -e releasenotes" it fails because it doesn't install
any of the sphinx or reno tools.  Add doc dependencies.

Change-Id: Ia8b864fbbe02f0963881d3a393b1a5935a3f16e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 04:26:09.000000000', 'message': "Move pre/post run task calls to queue

Since I33325fb5be21264df0a68ceef2202ab7875f63ec, the task.run() call
in TaskManager.run_task() is now an asynchronous submission to the
threadpool, rather than a synchronous call to the task's actual
function.  This means taking the elapsed_time around this call is no
longer an indication of the task's runtime, but always comes out as
just a few μs for the insertion.

Move the pre and post calls into TaskManager.submit_task() where the
elapsed_time will reflect the time between insertion into the queue
and the wait() return of its result.

Update documentation for pre/post tasks, and add test-cases.  Ignore
pep8 rule that can't handle line-continuations with with: statements.

Change-Id: I8617ab2895d1544a6902ae5a3d6a97b87bfd2ec9
"}, {'created': '2018-10-26 04:28:18.000000000', 'message': "Call pre/post run task calls from TaskManager.submit_task()

in TaskManager.run_task() is now an asynchronous submission to the

commit_message:
Call pre/post run task calls from TaskManager.submit_task()

Since I33325fb5be21264df0a68ceef2202ab7875f63ec, the task.run() call
in TaskManager.run_task() is now an asynchronous submission to the
threadpool, rather than a synchronous call to the task's actual
function.  This means taking the elapsed_time around this call is no
longer an indication of the task's runtime, but always comes out as
just a few μs for the insertion.

Move the pre and post calls into TaskManager.submit_task() where the
elapsed_time will reflect the time between insertion into the queue
and the wait() return of its result.

Update documentation for pre/post tasks, and add test-cases.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613438
Change-Id: I8617ab2895d1544a6902ae5a3d6a97b87bfd2ec9

commit_message:
Allow streaming raw partition images

This change removes the safeguard that prevented the partition images
from being converted to the raw format when HTTP is used as a source.

Story: #2003809
Task: #26567
Change-Id: If43ca82a830e416596dc751256d0a3bcce4a5630
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605707/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 11:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Reword open source definition in the Four Opens

The current phrasing states "Truly open source software is not feature
or performance limited and is not crippled."

Crippled in that context means it is not disabled or limited in any
manner by the fact the software is open source. As a non-native English
speaker, the first impression on looking up that adjective on the
internet is that it is an English word used to describe people with
disabilities, sometimes in a pejorative manner. Its translation to the
Portuguese word 'aleijado' which does not seem respectful, translating
back to 'crippled', 'lame' or 'gammy'.

As it led me to confusion, it may lead others too, specially in a
community where almost every country in this planet is represented.

This patch suggests the removal of that part of the sentence, leaving
"Truly open source software is not feature or performance limited."
which still has the same meaning that is clear and thus does not need
to be emphasized by that adjective.

Change-Id: I29b6cea609ae9db9c9ff678c28744de4570486ca
'}]
commit_message:
Reword open source definition in the Four Opens

The current phrasing states "Truly open source software is not feature
or performance limited and is not crippled."

Crippled in that context means it is not disabled or limited in any
manner by the fact the software is open source. As a non-native English
speaker, the first impression on looking up that adjective on the
internet is that it is an English word used to describe people with
disabilities, sometimes in a pejorative manner. Its translation to the
Portuguese word 'aleijado' which does not seem respectful, translating
back to 'crippled', 'lame' or 'gammy'.

As it led me to confusion, it may lead others too, specially in a
community where almost every country in this planet is represented.

This patch suggests the removal of that part of the sentence, leaving
"Truly open source software is not feature or performance limited."
which still has the same meaning that is clear and thus does not need
to be emphasized by that adjective.

Change-Id: I29b6cea609ae9db9c9ff678c28744de4570486ca

commit_message:
Improve volume transfer records

This spec proposes to improve volume transfer records by
adding ``original_project_id`` and ``current_project_id``,
``accept`` fields to ``transfer`` table and related api
responses, makes it easier for users to trace and audit the
volume transfer history.

Change-Id: Ia6f1824f44a6297fc3696bdf4a86f0d0758583c6
Blueprint: improve-volume-transfer-records

commit_message:
Drop strict-order flag from dnsmasq invocation

Without this flag, dnsmasq prefers to ask the servers that
are known to be up, rather than hitting servers that are either
down or known to be broken. This greatly reduces responsivity
impact of broken upstream servers.

Closes-Bug: #1746000
Change-Id: Ieee4dafc578c3bda0935fcdb80faad6c342a10e9
(cherry picked from commit d3c69dc4f22ef96ad3fb66430ce703d9c2199d2e)

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
  in the check queue only. Remove individual cover jobs.
* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.

Change-Id: I5945969c4afbb61fc97271ed09dad61e0c96ae62

In python3.6 the path used by os.path.join can be either
a string or bytes, so mock the neutron.common.config.init
to return a string so the tests pass with python3.6.

Change-Id: I10b399edb76b2ed3a2a235f9f4ec278ef94c4251
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-09-22 11:10:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit tests with py3.6

In python3.6 the path used by os.path.join can be either

commit_message:
Fix unit tests with py3.6

In python3.6 the path used by os.path.join can be either
a string or bytes, so mock the neutron.common.config.init
to return a string so the tests pass with python3.6.

Change-Id: I10b399edb76b2ed3a2a235f9f4ec278ef94c4251
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
hpe 3par driver initialization failure

do_setup call fails if the stats passed has the missing
array_id, in such cases it should use the client login
to fetch the array_id information.

Change-Id: I36d75fbe18770d6e3ae03c05d5392f8141082a0f
Closes-bug: #1790005

commit_message:
Add permanent ARP entries for DVR fip/qrouter veth pair

Since we know the IP and MAC addresses of both sides of the
fip/qrouter namespace veth pair device, just add permanent
ARP entries for them.

Change-Id: I6193b00681dfb79222eedfd00c89620321ac1b4f
Related-Bug: #1791989
(cherry picked from commit ac5815a110f0033c1a217481822fc0c72c1ba16c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 06:49:10.000000000', 'message': 'Storwize: modify hyperswap host_site configuration

The new configuration storwize_preferred_host_site was introduced in
volume type for hyperswap feature on Queens release. Actually, the
host_site is related to host rather than volume.

This patch removes the parameter storwzie_preferred_host_site from
volume type configuration and updates it from StrOpt to DictOpt in cinder
back-end configuration.

Closes-Bug:  1742866

Change-Id: Ie1df4cc45c2d1f72f33beea7ddc5bb3797a34728
(cherry picked from commit b13a8f810b143f5f0f465ab45eab453c1e65de7d)
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: modify hyperswap host_site configuration

The new configuration storwize_preferred_host_site was introduced in
volume type for hyperswap feature on Queens release. Actually, the
host_site is related to host rather than volume.

This patch removes the parameter storwzie_preferred_host_site from
volume type configuration and updates it from StrOpt to DictOpt in cinder
back-end configuration.

Closes-Bug:  1742866

Change-Id: Ie1df4cc45c2d1f72f33beea7ddc5bb3797a34728
(cherry picked from commit b13a8f810b143f5f0f465ab45eab453c1e65de7d)

A subordinate charm will be provided to control configuration of
transitional migration support for forwarding LBaasV2 API calls
sent to the Neutron API to the Octavia API endpoint.

This change allow such a subordinate charm to control this
configuration through existing interfaces by presenting itself with
``load-balancer`` as plugin name.

Change-Id: Id9f7ffb3d363c7606d92af592b9803644046d865
'}, {'created': '2018-10-27 21:46:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron-load-balancer interface

The Neutron built-in LBaaS provider is deprecated as of
OpenStack version Queens and the service is to be replaced
by a separate service such as Octavia.

This interface serves the purpose of notifying a external
load balancer service of when the Neutron API is ready to
accept queries.

In a transition period it is also used by the ``neutron-api``

the ``lbaasv2-proxy`` driver to proxy load balancer requests
sent to the Neutron API to the external service.

Change-Id: Id9f7ffb3d363c7606d92af592b9803644046d865

commit_message:
Add neutron-load-balancer interface

The Neutron built-in LBaaS provider is deprecated as of
OpenStack version Queens and the service is to be replaced
by a separate service such as Octavia.

This interface serves the purpose of notifying a external
load balancer service of when the Neutron API is ready to
accept queries.

In a transition period it is also used by the ``neutron-api``
charm to determine whether it should configure Neutron with
the legacy LBaaS provider enabled or if it should enable
the ``lbaasv2-proxy`` driver to proxy load balancer requests
sent to the Neutron API to the external service.

Change-Id: Id9f7ffb3d363c7606d92af592b9803644046d865

[{'created': '2018-08-13 20:31:26.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0060c6ff2c29ea8dd3f2ff5c037dab234860dfa9
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0060c6ff2c29ea8dd3f2ff5c037dab234860dfa9

[WIP] Add Swift Chart

A helm chart for OpenStack Swift.
This patchset doesn't include day 2 operations like ongoing
ring management, node addition or subtraction, which will be
added in a future patchset.

Change-Id: I8770184336321d4cf163d0de582175de66089a9f

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS Native Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
native driver.

TODO: gluster deps in kolla image and testing

Change-Id: I4d8beef668539a1ad26bc1199f23f9ea7e133cd0

Looks properly updated, a few points mentioned below:'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-09-25 06:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-09-25 06:21:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(8 comments)

Thanks for the review.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2018-09-25 13:46:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

One of the advantages we have today with not doing an automatic re-init attempt is that the failure gives immediate feedback to the admin/deployer who is trying to config and stand up volume services.  This immediate feedback gives them a chance to correct any problems.   Most of the driver not initialized failures are serious problems that won't be fixed with a retry."}, {'account_id': 28747, 'date': '2018-09-25 15:21:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > One of the advantages we have today with not doing an automatic
 > re-init attempt is that the failure gives immediate feedback to the
 > admin/deployer who is trying to config and stand up volume
 > services.  This immediate feedback gives them a chance to correct
 > any problems.   Most of the driver not initialized failures are
 > serious problems that won't be fixed with a retry.

Better make it configurable (0 infinite, maybe default to 3?). There are cases where the backend is just not ready yet and we want to wait for it. I.e. LVM is on DRBD and not yet primary but cinder was started or Ceph is not yet up due to monitors still being in configuring state on other hosts. This is how we use it in starlingx."}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-09-26 02:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-09-26 02:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-10 12:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Overall I really like the idea. Still thinking about things though, so just wanted to leave a couple comments.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Thanks for your review. @Sean McGinnis

About the two options, I am wondering whether we can just have the option retry_count. By default, Cinder will retry 3 times if a recoverable error happens. How do you think?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

retry_count seems reasonable to me. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Driver reinitialization after failure

This is a proposal to reinitialize a volume driver
when it fails during starting.

Change-Id: I99d047da270a28adb1b303af4c5140d678e1065d
Implements: blueprint driver-initialization-after-fail

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I9338a3732e92cf04c57c61e4a04a25305a6133e7

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I21b6a57892fc7ec6e64e436597608e494478cef6
Story: #2004073
Task: #27459

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I70b9ceaf7359dbfa508f250928c41c97218499f5

commit_message:
New Repo - OpenStack-Helm Images

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the dockerfiles that are spread throughout the
openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and openstack-helm-infra
repos.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611892
Change-Id: I50d43a0f4511c361941aab286ed8ce068ad2ddb0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Ensure namespace and network policy compatibility

This patch ensures namespace handler does not depend on specific
functions implemented on the security group driver for the namespace
isolation. This way it will be possible to enable the namespace
handler (to create a different network per namespace) together with
the network policy that will perform the isolation between pods/svc
in a different way.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Closes-Bug: #1799496
Change-Id: Ied892e616075ce16fdc15ceb31219c100e011536
(cherry picked from commit 651da66af1191053a96b283aa6d890fd8488438d)

commit_message:
Retire project Anchor - Step 5

This change follows step 5 from the manual[0] for retiring a
project by removing anchor from the list of maintained
projects by the Security SIG.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I6b848e4bccaf8a713be60ab52ec1668934a70653

commit_message:
Import puppet-crane

This puppet module provides a way to configure Crane (a lightweight
docker pull API).

The intent is to use this as an option for TripleO underclouds.

Depends-On: Ifdc403ca0faa57e61359707a5fc25a9dfa20e031
Change-Id: I897ce8b601bda54b0334eefbd8879e2587ee5515

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I0690c95e31b443ba2b842e7f72edd9c160723997

commit_message:
Allow more complex cells setup

Refactored simple_cell_setup.yml (renamed cell_setup.yml) to perform
different functions based on whether "cell_specifications" exists in
scope and was written to passwords.yml.  Also adds the ability to
deploy this to a nova hypervisor without making cell changes.

This depends on the nova patch that adds apply_cells action to
the nova-manage CLI.

Co-Authored-By: David Bingham <dbingham@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kris Lindgren <klindgren@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Fasenfest <jfasenfest@godaddy.com>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568987/

commit_message:
Remove references to log translation functions

No new implementers of this library should be using the log-oriented
marker functions, so we shouldn't be providing examples of them.
This change removes them from the sample integration module and
updates the usage examples to reflect the current best practices.

Change-Id: I0ae89cb3500821465438ee1f5572ab5e3573044c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-30 19:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Add IPv6 csnat port address correctly

If router gateway info update, in l3_dvr_db will receive events,
We will get subnets from router attached DVR port, if exists
multiple IPv6 slaac-enabled subnets, previous code will create
csnat port form one of the IPv6 subnets.
This is inconsistency with router interface
udpate in _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update.

This patch adds all IPv6 subnets if the distributed
router port have multiple IPv6 subnets.

Change-Id: I02ffed238897ebc91b96aebb7f94ed90b7613769
Closes-Bug: #1786169
(cherry picked from commit c6aac9041f98f971cd1362bee2768a04bbe5cf1d)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Add IPv6 csnat port address correctly

If router gateway info update, in l3_dvr_db will receive events,
We will get subnets from router attached DVR port, if exists
multiple IPv6 slaac-enabled subnets, previous code will create
csnat port form one of the IPv6 subnets.
This is inconsistency with router interface
udpate in _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update.

This patch adds all IPv6 subnets if the distributed
router port have multiple IPv6 subnets.

Change-Id: I02ffed238897ebc91b96aebb7f94ed90b7613769
Closes-Bug: #1786169
(cherry picked from commit c6aac9041f98f971cd1362bee2768a04bbe5cf1d)

messages: [{'account_id': 28671, 'date': '2018-10-26 18:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-10-27 12:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28713, 'date': '2018-10-29 12:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-10-29 13:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 18:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix home direcroty path in trovestack script

This simple fix solves "no such file or directory" error when user
home directory is not prefixed by /home.

This is the case, for example in devstack, where stack user home is
set to /opt/stack/.

Lets use $HOME variable to determine user home location.

Change-Id: I07432d27e1a2035296bc62793fecbe13d0265e7b
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix home direcroty path in trovestack script

This simple fix solves "no such file or directory" error when user
home directory is not prefixed by /home.

This is the case, for example in devstack, where stack user home is
set to /opt/stack/.

Lets use $HOME variable to determine user home location.

Change-Id: I07432d27e1a2035296bc62793fecbe13d0265e7b
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 17:50:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7

Both of mysql trove-scenario jobs performed the same tests

This change sets correct group for trove-scenario-mysql-multi job.

Furthermore, to be consistent, trove_test_datastore has been passed

commit_message:
Fix incorrect test_group in zull job definition

Both of mysql trove-scenario jobs performed the same tests
group (mysql-supported-single).

This change sets correct group for trove-scenario-mysql-multi job.

Furthermore, to be consistent, trove_test_datastore has been passed
explicite for trove-scenario-mysql-single job.

Change-Id: I377e17ebf690c79d1c369116697177f992b3df65
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-29 14:52:05.000000000', 'message': 'Automating generation of API doc sample files

Nova has implemented the method of generating sample files using
functional tests which records API responses in api sample files,
matches and updates if any mismatch occurs, which makes it quite
easier to keep the documentation up to date.
This spec proposes implementing the same idea in cinder.

Change-Id: I5eef2ab6cd03747c972a3c19d0666e053af44270
blueprint: generating-sample-files
'}]
commit_message:
Automating generation of API doc sample files

Nova has implemented the method of generating sample files using
functional tests which records API responses in api sample files,
matches and updates if any mismatch occurs, which makes it quite
easier to keep the documentation up to date.
This spec proposes implementing the same idea in cinder.

Change-Id: I5eef2ab6cd03747c972a3c19d0666e053af44270
blueprint: generating-sample-files

Defines the specifications for implementing MySQL Cluster support
for Cinder.

As at the Design Summit we've agreed to start without automatic cleanup, so this spec should be reworked a little.

If I'm getting it right, in current state of the design auto-fencing should occur in case of disconnection from the DLM only. Disconnection from the DB or RPC shouldn't make a big problem now.

Also I still believe that auto-fencing should be an option instead of the only possibility."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2015-11-17 16:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Disconnection from the DB would still be a problem because then the manual triggering of the cleanup would create simultaneous access to the same resource on the storage backend.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2015-11-17 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-17 17:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

I'm thinking of changing the way to do the auto fencing, but I have to do some actual tests to confirm if it works and I won't get to it until I finish implementing the cleanup spec."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2016-05-13 14:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Still needed?'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2016-05-17 10:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I do believe this is still needed, but I want to update existing patches with the changes agreed in Austin before going back to the drawing board with this one.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2016-05-27 22:24:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'm pretty sure this is a fundamental spec; so it will probably always be needed unless another solution comes along to fix the same underlying/core issue."}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2016-08-01 12:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-10-13 16:59:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Should we abandon this? Pick it up again? Propose a cross-project effort for a common A/A method? Just looking for either moving this along or getting rid of it since it's been sitting out here for so long."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2017-10-13 19:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Hi Sean, thanks for the nudge on this.  I think it's a super-important topic since it's a critical component of a reliable A/A architecture, so I'd definitely vote to keep it.  Yes, maybe a cross-project initiative makes sense if you know of any other projects which have a similar need?

Either way, I'd be happy to help get the right people talking to each other to drive this forwards.  I'll ask the SBD gods for their opinion on this crazy idea I just wrote in this review :-)  And I'll be in Sydney, so maybe we can discuss then?  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2017-10-17 10:34:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just received an initial reply from Lars (original author of SBD):

> Yes, sbd can be used without pacemaker. It basically
> only integrates with pacemaker do monitor pacemaker health directly and
> observe pacemaker's opinion quorum.
> 
> You can't *build* it without pacemaker though, and it might pull in a
> few library dependencies. But that could probably be minimized easily
> enough and running it w/o a running pacemaker is certainly possible.

Any thoughts from the cinder experts here on whether there is enough merit in this idea to justify exploring it further?"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2017-10-18 17:23:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just added Andrew to the reviewer list so he can pour cold water and scorn on my crazy idea :)  One important question emerged from Duncan today: how could we know that a node self-fenced after losing connection to shared storage, in order to safely commence the recovery processes?  With standalone SBD and no Pacemaker I'm not sure how that could be accomplished.  If Pacemaker was required then that raises the question whether it's a sledgehammer to crack this particular walnut ...

BTW it's confirmed that Red Hat and SUSE both support SBD in our respective HA projects.  See also https://wiki.clusterlabs.org/wiki/Using_SBD_with_Pacemaker"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2017-11-21 20:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Andrew and I talked to Jay about this in Sydney, and it turns out that we were probably misunderstanding the exact failure scenarios which this spec is attempting to cover.  I'm struggling to remember the conclusions we came to, but IIRC I think one was that SBD is probably not going to help.  Andrew, can you remember?

I probably need to go and read https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236977/ before commenting further on this."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

May get re-evaluated at a later time, but abandoning it for now.'}]

commit_message:
Auto-fencing to support HA A/A

This spec outlines work needed for volume nodes to auto-fence themselves
when they lose connection to the DB to prevent cleanup procedure to
access the same resources while the node keeps working on it.

This is one of the aspects that are needed to support Active/Active in
cinder.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I7da600824441341eed8cc13a48f35e50821d8156

 > it is trying to solve. Would a link to the relevant nova specs
 > help?

Thanks, Duncan, this is related to this proposal [1], and I am writing this to see if it can be done via Nova's placement service, but as you can see it still needs a lot of clarification now

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556529/"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-10 09:42:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(8 comments)

This is an excellent start, thank you very much for getting it going. There will probably be several iterations as we all work out what the common terms are but this gets the ball rolling nicely.

With help from Sean and Jay I've created a forum topic proposal related to this work: http://forumtopics.openstack.org/cfp/details/89

But hopefully before then we can get far enough along where what we are doing then is answering questions."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-04-10 12:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-04-11 09:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The explanation of the issue is way too brief, as it doesn't explain the issues we can expect when deploying the scheduler in active-active.  It should also say HA Active-Active, since Active-Passive is also HA and there would be no issues in that case.

I didn't read the whole document, because the first thing I expect to see when I read the proposed change is HOW having this new service is actually going to fix our issue, implementation details should come later, but the most important part is how we are going to deploy this new placement service in HA A/A and it's not going to have the same kind of issues.

I think I prefer the DB alternatives, both the proposed in the spec and one that sums up based on existing DB entries (which could be done with the same query we use to do the new quota calculations."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-11 11:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think I prefer the DB alternatives, both the proposed in the spec
 > and one that sums up based on existing DB entries (which could be
 > done with the same query we use to do the new quota calculations.

One of the reasons for using placement for this is that it allows the concept of "resource providers" in the whole cloud to be managed in the same way. For situations where Cinder is being used without Nova or Neutron this may not matter, but where it is, having a consistent system for resource availability tracking, one that can be made aware of associations between resources, is good.

I agree that the spec needs a lot more information on the problem being solved and the ways in which a placement-oriented solution is a good choice, but it is a WIP after all, it will move in that direction, yeah?'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

> > I think I prefer the DB alternatives, both the proposed in the
 > spec
 > > and one that sums up based on existing DB entries (which could be
 > > done with the same query we use to do the new quota calculations.
 > 
 > One of the reasons for using placement for this is that it allows
 > the concept of "resource providers" in the whole cloud to be
 > managed in the same way. For situations where Cinder is being used
 > without Nova or Neutron this may not matter, but where it is,
 > having a consistent system for resource availability tracking, one
 > that can be made aware of associations between resources, is good.
 > 
 > I agree that the spec needs a lot more information on the problem
 > being solved and the ways in which a placement-oriented solution is
 > a good choice, but it is a WIP after all, it will move in that
 > direction, yeah?

That is not what the spec says it's for, it says it's to fix the Scheduler when deployed as HA, if this is to add a new service to do something fancy when we can't even do basic scheduling right, then I'm definitely against this, as it will most likely be nested quotas all over again.

If this is a proper solution for deploying schedulers in HA A/A I'm open to discussion, so I'll wait for an update on how this can actually fix our current issues, otherwise it's a hard no.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-04-21 02:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

After the PTG discussion in Denver, we realized placement will not be able to meet some of the needs we have for this due to some of the dynamic data we use. Abandoning for now, but if there is a different compelling reason to introduce placement, please restore and update.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 15:40:17.000000000', 'message': 'Always run py27 test

The py27 test ensures that all specs are following a specific format.
The default py27 tests have an irrelevant-files list that ignores
running if especially only .rst files get updated. Override the
irrelevant files list so that it runs for nearly all changes,
only skip for release-notes (even if they do not exist here).

Change-Id: Iffb6345ddf490820ca7495f0e4a0e722acfba898
'}]
commit_message:
Always run py27 test

The py27 test ensures that all specs are following a specific format.
The default py27 tests have an irrelevant-files list that ignores
running if especially only .rst files get updated. Override the
irrelevant files list so that it runs for nearly all changes,
only skip for release-notes (even if they do not exist here).

Change-Id: Iffb6345ddf490820ca7495f0e4a0e722acfba898

subject: Support restore backup to volumes simultaneously
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 13157, 'name': 'Zhao Chao', 'email': 'zhaochao1984@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhaochao'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23083, 'name': 'TommyLike', 'email': 'tommylikehu@gmail.com', 'username': 'TommyLike'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]

Do current drivers and backend support it?'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2017-12-01 15:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-04 03:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)

Thanks Duncan Thomas'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-12 02:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-12 02:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Move this spec into Rocky folder.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-12 07:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-22 01:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-22 01:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-22 12:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Looks good overall. Would be great to get more input from others.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-12-22 16:27:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(5 comments)

Some details inline... but I do have a few concerns:
1. Resource utilization/consumption
2. Can we do this without the addition of the new table

I'll leave item 1 to you; but item #2 is one I'd like to understand better if we really need that or not?  I think we can achieve the same end-result by improving the backup table that already exists and fix up some logic.  The additional table the way I read it just represents a process and I'm not sure I see a big advantage to that."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-26 08:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-12-26 08:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-01-02 16:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

What happens when you try to do this when using the "generic backup implementation" feature which loads a volume driver and uses it to perform backup?

    https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/pike/generic-backup-implementation.html

I believe this proposal assumes that those drivers will be able to do read-only multiattach, which is not guaranteed.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-03 07:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> What happens when you try to do this when using the "generic backup
 > implementation" feature which loads a volume driver and uses it to
 > perform backup?
 > 
 > https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/pike/generic-backup-implementation.html
 > 
 > I believe this proposal assumes that those drivers will be able to
 > do read-only multiattach, which is not guaranteed.

Thanks for your reminder, will update this spec according to this:)'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-03 08:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-01-03 09:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-05 03:19:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

And some thoughts related, as usually there are several cinder-backup instance, and maybe with shared shared storage backend (Ceph, GlusterFS, NFS, etc), it's worthy to find ways to distribute backup creating/restoring to all nodes, especially after this feature is implemented."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-08 06:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-27 02:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-27 02:40:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > And some thoughts related, as usually there are several
 > cinder-backup instance, and maybe with shared shared storage
 > backend (Ceph, GlusterFS, NFS, etc), it's worthy to find ways to
 > distribute backup creating/restoring to all nodes, especially after
 > this feature is implemented.

That's a good point, I will bring this to PTG in Dublin."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:29:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

This whole idea is, in my opinion, a terrible one where a new feature is required because users want to use the wrong mechanism as a workaround for some self inflicted limitation they have.

Backups are not meant to be used for this, they are meant to have a 1-to-1 relation with volumes, and not be used as a mechanism to provision new volumes.

For volume provisioning we have many other mechanisms:

- Volume cloning
- Glance images stored in the same backend as Cinder so that Cinder can automatically clone from them.
- Public glance images that can be cached by Cinder to quickly create new volumes.

Backups are the worst possible mechanism for this:

- They are really slow to create
- With the default configuration they are also CPU intensive to create and to restore.
- Concurrent restores also use a lot more RAM than any other mechanism.
- If they are incremental backups the restoration is even worse in terms of efficiency.

I really don't see any reason why this is necessary, and the use case presented in the spec doesn't really help sell this ide."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-02-28 13:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Support restore backup to volumes simultaneously

This spec proposes supporting restore backup to
different volumes simultaneously.

Change-Id: I7467e9526f9be54ae79d6a3306d4a08bf2ec6cc4
Partial-Implements: bp support-simultaneously-restore-backups

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting,
which is replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx
releases >= 1.5[0]. This also fixes any warnings
that came up when testing with the latest version
of sphinx:

- Redundant loading of todo extension
- Empty man_pages config value

Also updated the requirements for pbr and sphinx to the latest
version(s) in requirements.txt

With this change, any doc warnings will cause the build to fail
[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I1252b1912aa16240678c4b48af935d27131e9a0d

commit_message:
Remove race between sync_pools and _get_port_from_pool

This patch ensures that if there is an attempt to allocate a
port during the pod creation but the kuryr-controller has not yet
finished its sync_pool initialization, a ResourceNotReady exception
will be triggered and the port allocation attempt will be retried
later

Closes-Bug: 1800431
Change-Id: I92671523db6e9efc40ff248018c4e081fae750ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-18 12:39:52.000000000', 'message': 'Support storing volume format info

Currently, there are several filesystem-based drivers in Cinder, such as
nfs, glusterfs, smbfs, etc. Multiple formats of volume other than "raw" can be
potentially supported in these drivers, such as qcow2, raw, vhd, etc.

This work aims to handle these files of various formats safely and
in a more robust manner.

blueprint add-support-store-volume-format-info

commit_message:
Support storing volume format info

Currently, there are several filesystem-based drivers in Cinder, such as
nfs, glusterfs, smbfs, etc. Multiple formats of volume other than "raw" can be
potentially supported in these drivers, such as qcow2, raw, vhd, etc.

This work aims to handle these files of various formats safely and
in a more robust manner.

blueprint add-support-store-volume-format-info

Co-Authored-By: Trump Zhang <zhangleiqiang@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8b66af1d6b41f02a870d95cd9dddab83c34a9ded

subject: WIP: Add QoS to NFS driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 17405, 'date': '2016-08-26 20:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17405, 'date': '2016-08-26 20:29:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-26 20:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-cinder-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/56/361456/1/check/gate-cinder-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/b40a620//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 26s
- gate-cinder-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/56/361456/1/check/gate-cinder-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/d196edd/ : SUCCESS in 5m 08s'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2016-08-28 14:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Seems like a place-holder spec (which is probably no bad thing).

Assuming qemu can do QoS for volume images in a similar way to what it can do for iSCSI block devices, I'd expect most of the work to be done on the nova end - cinder just provides the QoS info in the connector."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2016-08-31 00:54:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's great that you go the extra mile and write these sorts of things up in a spec.  I do want to confirm though, you're not actually changing anything other than the driver here correct?  QoS is already a *thing* so I'm assuming you're just making it possible for the NFS driver to utilize that extra-spec info like some other drivers no?"}, {'account_id': 17405, 'date': '2016-08-31 18:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey John, 

Yep you are correct. The purpose of this spec is to add QoS functionality only to the NFS driver. Currently I am still figuring out the specifics of how this will be done, but I expect NFS would use extra-spec info like some of the other drivers. I will keep yea guys posted on what I am thinking.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2016-08-31 18:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You should use the QoS spec object. Custom extra specs should not be necessary and are unlikely to be acceptable'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2016-09-26 17:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2017-03-16 20:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Like Duncan said, I think the key to this is to leverage qemu's front-end QoS for NFS volumes.

I don't know what pieces may still be missing there, but some thinking has begun around using qemu directly for NFS to support volume encryption as well.  This would fit into the same scheme.

The spec should be moved to the "Pike" folder rather than "Ocata" now.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2017-09-04 12:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Erlon R. Cruz <sombrafam@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:04:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Add QoS to NFS driver

Currently the NFS driver does not support QoS. This spec proposes
adding QoS functionality to the NFS driver and will give an
outline of how it can possibly be achieved.

Change-Id: Ia6b23cd68b1ca3e0d9152edb7325a14ac39f7ffd
Implements: blueprint add-qos-to-nfs

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I8a8766706f60a75c546fa338943630a28f3670f2

subject: Remove master only periodic jobs
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-19 04:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-09-20 11:56:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I like this change; please see my comment on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595808/1 .  I should be more clear about my dislike: this change is technically fine, but since the point of https://review.openstack.org/586334 is that we should not have to maintain .zuul.yaml in the stable branches, I'd prefer keeping the stable/rocky .zuul.yaml looking just like master."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-25 18:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

These are just cruft, the extra lines will never be used. My style is to remove these instead of adding them needlessly.

But If you prefer this cruft, feel free to -1...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-25 18:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Btw. we just discussed this on #openstack-infra, see http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2018-09-25.log.html#t2018-09-25T17:59:40'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:01:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Andreas: sorry for the slow follow-up, i've been preoccupied with some other issues.  I read through the discussion you helpfully linked.  I'll bring this up at the weekly Glance meeting.  My original proposal, believe it or not, was to have the release CPL put up a patch like the one you have here immediately after each stable branch is created, but the team felt that it would be better to find a solution that didn't require manual intervention.  But as you point out, what I did come up with will leave some cruft in each stable branch.  Let's see what the team thinks."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brian, IMHO the best way is to move this back to project-config...'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Andreas: I'll make sure your opinion is heard at the glance meeting on Thursday."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks, Brian.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So here's a crazy idea ... I was looking at the .zuul.yaml again and noticed that the abstract jobs are the ones where the repos we test against are defined.  Would it be possible to keep the abstract jobs in our repo, and put the actual jobs in project-config?  (And what would happen if someone deleted the abstract jobs by mistake? Would that break zuul for everyone, or just for us?)"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:27:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian, that's how Zuul is defined ;)

You keep the job definitions here. You just move the following lines to project-config (from glance_store master):

   periodic:
      jobs:
        - glance_store-tox-py27-cinder-tips:
            branches: master
        ...

Zuul does not allow removing a job that is defined, so if you try removing a job defiinition, zuul will complain and give a -1."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brian, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604114/ - that fails with -1 when removing a job that is still in use...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-29 14:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not wanted'}]

commit_message:
Trivial code cleanups

Cleaning up comments and logging to make sure they properly adhere
to Openstack standards.

* Consistently use """ instead of ''' for comments.
* Always lazy-load logging parameters.
* Fixed bad log line in cert_manager.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 01:23:03.000000000', 'message': 'dhcp: serializing port delete and network rpc calls

The port delete events are not synchronized with network rpc events.  This
creates a condition which makes it possible for a port delete event to be
processed just before a previously started network query completes.

The problematic order of operations is as follows:

  1) a network is scheduled to an agent; a network rpc is sent to the
     agent

  2) the agent queries the network data from the server

  3) while that query is in progress a port on that network is deleted; a
     port rpc is sent to the agent

  4) that port delete rpc is received before the network query rpc
     completes

  5) the port delete results in no action because the port was not present
     on the agent

  6) the network query finishes and adds the port to the cache (even
     though the port has already been deleted)

  7) some time passes and a new port is configured with the same IP
     address as the port that was deleted in (3)

  8) the dhcp host file is corrupted with 2 entries for the same IP
     address.

  9) dhcp queries for the newest port is rejected because of the duplicate
     entry in the dhcp host file.

The solution is to add the network_id to the port_delete_end rpc event
so that the _net_lock(network_id) synchronization point can be acquired
so that it is processed serially with other network related events.

To ensure backwards compatibility with newer agents running against older
servers the determination of which network_id value to use in the lock is
handled using a utility that will fallback to the previous mode of operation
whenever the network_id attribute is not present in the *_delete_end RPC
events.  That utility can be removed in the future when it is guaranteed
that the network_id attribute will be present in RPC messages from the
server.

Closes-Bug: #1732456

Change-Id: I735f8b1c9248b12e5feb6cbe970cf67f321e6ebc
Signed-off-by: Allain Legacy <allain.legacy@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit fa78b580105111b1238e5b18d415b08e8fb35d97)
'}]
commit_message:
dhcp: serializing port delete and network rpc calls

The port delete events are not synchronized with network rpc events.  This
creates a condition which makes it possible for a port delete event to be
processed just before a previously started network query completes.

The problematic order of operations is as follows:

  1) a network is scheduled to an agent; a network rpc is sent to the
     agent

  2) the agent queries the network data from the server

  3) while that query is in progress a port on that network is deleted; a
     port rpc is sent to the agent

  4) that port delete rpc is received before the network query rpc
     completes

  5) the port delete results in no action because the port was not present
     on the agent

  6) the network query finishes and adds the port to the cache (even
     though the port has already been deleted)

  7) some time passes and a new port is configured with the same IP
     address as the port that was deleted in (3)

  8) the dhcp host file is corrupted with 2 entries for the same IP
     address.

  9) dhcp queries for the newest port is rejected because of the duplicate
     entry in the dhcp host file.

The solution is to add the network_id to the port_delete_end rpc event
so that the _net_lock(network_id) synchronization point can be acquired
so that it is processed serially with other network related events.

To ensure backwards compatibility with newer agents running against older
servers the determination of which network_id value to use in the lock is
handled using a utility that will fallback to the previous mode of operation
whenever the network_id attribute is not present in the *_delete_end RPC
events.  That utility can be removed in the future when it is guaranteed
that the network_id attribute will be present in RPC messages from the
server.

Closes-Bug: #1732456

Change-Id: I735f8b1c9248b12e5feb6cbe970cf67f321e6ebc
Signed-off-by: Allain Legacy <allain.legacy@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit fa78b580105111b1238e5b18d415b08e8fb35d97)

[{'created': '2018-10-24 19:56:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix random_mac_generator to make proper EUI64s

The initial implementation of random_mac_generator created MAC addresses
that were one octet too long - the MAC addresses would have seven octets
instead of the proper EUI64-standard six.

commit_message:
Fix random_mac_generator to make proper EUI64s

The initial implementation of random_mac_generator created MAC addresses
that were one octet too long - the MAC addresses would have seven octets
instead of the proper EUI64-standard six.

This resolved testing issues in the consuming patch in Neutron (see
the change referenced in the Needed-By line).  A test is added that
replicates the conditions of the failure.  In the failed tests, the base
mac '12:34:56:78' was instead parsed so it became '12:34:56:7:8'; when
the code went to add 2 octets to the result, there were too many octets
to form a valid EUI64 MAC address.

Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/584061
Change-Id: I9a2c40709db9204c7686500deac9ee8e8471b1bc

commit_message:
Set rbd_cluster_name to cope with custom cluster names

Cinder requires the Ceph cluster name to be set explicitly in
rbd_cluster_name when not 'ceph'.

Change-Id: I880184255a1f7c39ae66bd8ad7c361d65d378a0c
Closes-Bug: 1796096
(cherry picked from commit 612279161ba26ac02791e20a6eb5aa22e8ac673a)

[{'created': '2018-10-23 19:33:59.000000000', 'message': "Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031

commit_message:
Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697
(cherry picked from commit bc36ef8fb6604f0285cc922d20430ed13c7bc332)

commit_message:
Disable tempest run on tripleo-ci-fedora-28-standalone

* Since tripleo-ci-fedora-28-standalone is not yet ready to support
  tempest and python3, till then let's disable tempest run on it.
  Once it is available we can enable tempest here.

Change-Id: If6047b5f19198789a07bb4b2e1dc16111355bf9c

commit_message:
podman: stop the docker container during upgrade

When deploying Podman containers, we want to make sure the container
that was running in Docker has been stopped.
That's part of the upgrade process, where later, we'll remove the
container in THT / upgrade_tasks.

Change-Id: I6831b4b952c95fde31febf8e14cb27cf22ff859b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 10:12:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IHA with the new region_name key

ia change f2e72352b1376ce719614e9cad4e4c71a3f9c3d8 we did the following
in nova-base.yaml:
- nova::placement::os_region_name: {get_param: KeystoneRegion}
+ nova::placement::region_name: {get_param: KeystoneRegion}

But in the IHA script we looked for the os_region_name config key in the
placemenet ini section of nova.conf, which is now missing.
We need to adapt that script as well. Without this fix we'll error
out like this:
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]:   File "/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute", line 147, in create_nova_connection
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]:     region_name=options["os_region_name"][0],
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]: KeyError: 'os_region_name'

Closes-Bug: #1798560

Change-Id: I8906145955ab6c444efdfa73beca073a62c26e26
(cherry picked from commit 9235e30c0819d1283a55029f73b4d40fbe6625fe)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix IHA with the new region_name key

ia change f2e72352b1376ce719614e9cad4e4c71a3f9c3d8 we did the following
in nova-base.yaml:
- nova::placement::os_region_name: {get_param: KeystoneRegion}
+ nova::placement::region_name: {get_param: KeystoneRegion}

But in the IHA script we looked for the os_region_name config key in the
placemenet ini section of nova.conf, which is now missing.
We need to adapt that script as well. Without this fix we'll error
out like this:
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]:   File "/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute", line 147, in create_nova_connection
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]:     region_name=options["os_region_name"][0],
Oct 16 09:08:12 overcloud-novacomputeiha-0 dockerd-current[14673]: KeyError: 'os_region_name'

Closes-Bug: #1798560

Change-Id: I8906145955ab6c444efdfa73beca073a62c26e26
(cherry picked from commit 9235e30c0819d1283a55029f73b4d40fbe6625fe)

commit_message:
bug fix: fix 2 bugs for image client

1. missing glance config section

2. missing import keystoneauth1.exceptions
When call glance fail during download image, it will report:
 NameError: global name 'ks_exc' is not defined

Change-Id: I17f25368f3361b4fc20a0eda9d6b2788beaa6362

commit_message:
Remove autopep8 and formencode from test-requirements.txt

It looks these dependencies are listed in test requirements but not
used in the code. In addition, they are not included in the openstack
global requirement so this commit removes them from the list.

Change-Id: I61c20979b3bbf9b87a5b7285d11efff6b6e3f923

have the --regex arguments.

commit_message:
Update lxc_hosts role SHA for apt failures

The 'apt-get upgrade' does not set confdef and
confold currently, so an upgrade which requires
user input can break the cache build[1].

This patch updates the lxc_hosts role SHA to include
Ic6689387a28539b7eb341d55a9db08f078e8e975

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/733076/

Change-Id: I7a50a64a4759865bceccc6ae02132663c328172b

On certain Neutron backends such as OVN where no agents are used,
it's unnecessary to have (so many)RPC workers running. This patch is
decoupling the number of API and RPC workers for neutron server.

In the case that the new NeutronRpcWorkers parameter is not defined,
it'll take the value of NeutronWorkers so that we don't introduce
any regression if some environments don't define it.

commit_message:
Decoupling number of API and RPC workers for neutron-api

On certain Neutron backends such as OVN where no agents are used,
it's unnecessary to have (so many)RPC workers running. This patch is
decoupling the number of API and RPC workers for neutron server.

In the case that the new NeutronRpcWorkers parameter is not defined,
it'll take the value of NeutronWorkers so that we don't introduce
any regression if some environments don't define it.

Change-Id: I0a3b78947fdeda638d0756f08b577d4351f371e0
Partial-Bug: #1786952
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set the number of RPC workers to 1 for non SRIOV OVN setups

OVN based backend setups don't need RPC communications as they
don't deploy Neutron agents (except for the SRIOV case).

For this reason and to minimize the resources used, this patch
is setting the number of RPC workers to the minimum, which is 1.

Change-Id: Icf84516f24873717cb7615233d2e6341414abfc7
Closes-Bug: #1786952
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 12:43:56.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3639551e0e8d0b05c7d76158b91771294d66a2c9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3639551e0e8d0b05c7d76158b91771294d66a2c9

change_node_power_state action can be used to make a host offline.
set_host_offline never be used and the Nova os-hosts API is deprecated.
So remove it
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-host-status-detail#hosts-os-hosts-deprecated

Change-Id: I5f81fc9e2189db39b143d2935540d637bd2d88cc
'}]
commit_message:
remove set_host_offline

change_node_power_state action can be used to make a host offline.
set_host_offline never be used and the Nova os-hosts API is deprecated.
So remove it
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-host-status-detail#hosts-os-hosts-deprecated

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 15:00:45.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup allocations held against
that compute node resource provider by evacuated
instances, but doesn't take into account that those
evacuated instances could have been deleted in the
meantime which leads to a lazy-load InstanceNotFound
error that kills the startup of the service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I19b0d8baea5440f5d5bc49a6956d9a97bf031a05
Related-Bug: #1794996

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests from the hypervisor
and allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Note that assertFlavorMatchesAllocation and
_boot_and_check_allocations are redefined in the test
class because If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c
refactored those methods which will cause problems with
backports of this test. The redefined methods will be
removed in a follow up cleanup patch.

Change-Id: I19b0d8baea5440f5d5bc49a6956d9a97bf031a05
Related-Bug: #1794996

commit_message:
Add volume-backed evacuate test

This adds a volume-backed instance evacuate scenario
to the test_evacuate post-test script.

Change-Id: I37120d9ce02de6dadbd279de195d2f289c891123

commit_message:
Add post-test hook for testing evacuate

This adds a post-test bash script to test evacuate
in a multinode job.

This performs two tests:

1. A negative test where we inject a fault by stopping
   libvirt prior to the evacuation and wait for the
   server to go to ERROR status.

2. A positive where we restart libvirt, wait for the
   compute service to be enabled and then evacuate
   the server and wait for it to be ACTIVE.

For now we hack this into the nova-live-migration
job, but it should probably live in a different job
long-term.

Change-Id: I9b7c9ad6b0ab167ba4583681efbbce4b18941178
