commit_message:
Delete empty karaf directory on host

Mounting empty /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/
opendaylight/opt/opendaylight/etc/opendaylight/karaf
from host to /opt/opendaylight/etc/opendaylight/karaf
on container empties the folder on container itself.
Hence on restart/redeploy, ODL can't find files inside
that folder and can't start leading to deployment failure.

So delete the empty karaf folder on host so that the contents
of karaf folder inside the container is intact durin redeploy.

Change-Id: I75aabaa2abc0fc9ba789c53f27fc37cfb7769a8b
Closes-Bug: #1799395

commit_message:
Fix bad 'retry' role attribute

Until we have change to ansible-python-3 we have the following warning
[WARNING]: Ignoring invalid attribute: retry

But with package from fedora28 ansible-python3 it's stated as an error
ERROR! 'retry' is not a valid attribute for a Task

This try to fix this and maybe other problems, could be related to
ansible.cfg from fedora28.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/285?kanban-status=1447275
Change-Id: I0de43573ee37a08544452d7709308aa46ad35aa3

commit_message:
Function to apply workarounds

The workarounds can be either patches posted on review.openstack.org
 or arbitrary shell commands.
Below is an example of a workarounds:

---
pre_undercloud_upgrade_workaround:
  - BZ#xxxxxyz:
     patch: false
     basedir: ''
     id: ''
     command: 'touch /home/stack/pre_workaround_applied'
post_undercloud_deploy_workarounds:
  - BZ#xxxyyzz:
     patch: true
     basedir: '/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/'
     id: 'xxxyyzz'
     command: ''

Change-Id: Id33c6d9c043433b395d4a4905a36820a18604860

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets

Change-Id: I1a73f218112236d59ee54797e2e7666ceeb15844

commit_message:
Functional: Allow some time for propagating the healthcheck values

This patch is changing the test_metadata_agent_healthcheck to allow
some time (up to 5 seconds) for expected SB config value to be
propagated.

Prior to this patch, it was checked straight away and sometimes it
it didn't match the expected value.

Change-Id: Ia5308cda75571b624f84efa83cffe2acdc04f097
Related-Bug: #1719574
Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add solum-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for solum-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: Icd92e2105e99354a8b184d9be086cc97ce4c12fa
Story: 2003657
Task: 26155

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 15:41:14.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore forcing of live migration for nested instance

In the baseline during forced live migration nova blindy copied the
source allocation from the source compute RP to the destination compute
RP. When the instance has nested allocaton on the source host this blind
copy cannot be done any more as nova only knows the destination compure RP
but not nested RPs on tha compute to copy the instance allocation.

This patch proposes to ignore the force flag if the instance being live
migrated has nested allocation on the source host. By ignoring the force
flag conductor will call the scheduler to verify the destination host
provided and the scheduler will query allocation candidates from
placement restricted to the destination host for such validation. This
way scheduler can do the nested claim on the destination host.

This patch changes the behavior of force live migrate slightly as now it
can return NoValidHost if the provided host is invalid from placement or
scheduler perspective. However force live migrate already did pre-check
of the destination host and if that failed returned NoValidHost.
Therefore the current change can be considered an extended pre-check and
therefore not require an API microversion.

TODO:
* Add a functional test case when live migration happen from a flat
  compute to a reshaped nested compute to verify that the migration
  fails gracefully
* Make unit test pass

Change-Id: I7cbd5d9fb875ebf72995362e0b6693492ce32051
Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates
'}, {'created': '2018-09-27 15:46:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore forcing of live migration for nested instance

In the baseline during forced live migration nova blindy copied the
source allocation from the source compute RP to the destination compute
RP. When the instance has nested allocaton on the source host this blind
copy cannot be done any more as nova only knows the destination compure RP
but not nested RPs on tha compute to copy the instance allocation.

This patch proposes to ignore the force flag if the instance being live
migrated has nested allocation on the source host. By ignoring the force
flag conductor will call the scheduler to verify the destination host
provided and the scheduler will query allocation candidates from
placement restricted to the destination host for such validation. This
way scheduler can do the nested claim on the destination host.

This patch changes the behavior of force live migrate slightly as now it
can return NoValidHost if the provided host is invalid from placement or
scheduler perspective. However force live migrate already did pre-check
of the destination host and if that failed returned NoValidHost.
Therefore the current change can be considered an extended pre-check and
therefore not require an API microversion.

TODO:
* Add a functional test case when live migration happen from a flat
  compute to a reshaped nested compute to verify that the migration
  fails gracefully
* Make unit test pass

Change-Id: I7cbd5d9fb875ebf72995362e0b6693492ce32051
Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates

'}, {'created': '2018-10-10 16:03:01.000000000', 'message': 'Reject forced move with nested source allocation

Both os-live-migrate and evacuate server API actions support a force
flag. If force is set to True in the request then nova does not call the
scheduler but instead triest to blindly copy the source host allocation
to the desitnation host. If the source host allocation contains

properly. Therefore this patch detects such situation and rejects
the forced move operation if the server has complex allocations on the

force flag in a new API microversion.

commit_message:
Reject forced move with nested source allocation

Both os-migrateLive and evacuate server API actions support a force
flag. If force is set to True in the request then nova does not call the
scheduler but instead tries to blindly copy the source host allocation
to the desitnation host. If the source host allocation contains
resources from more than the root RP then such blind copy cannot be done
properly. Therefore this patch detects such situation and rejects
the forced move operation if the server has complex allocations on the
source host.

There is a separate bluperint
remove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate that will remove the
force flag in a new API microversion.

Note that before the force flag was added to these APIs Nova bypassed the
scheduler when the target host was specified.

Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: I7cbd5d9fb875ebf72995362e0b6693492ce32051

commit_message:
Remove 3node from CI

This job is continually broken and just eats up resources. Let's remove
this for now.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 14:16:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix os-simple-tenant-usage result order

nova usage-list can return incorrect results, having resources counted
twice. This only occurs when using the 2.40 microversion or later.

This microversion introduced pagination, which doesn't work properly.
Nova API will sort the instances using the tenant id and instance uuid,
but 'os-simple-tenant-usage' will not preserve the order when returning
the results.

For this reason, subsequent API calls made by the client will use the
wrong marker (which is supposed to be the last instance id), ending
up counting the same instances twice.

Change-Id: I6c7a67b23ec49aa207c33c38580acd834bb27e3c
Closes-Bug: #1796689

commit_message:
Fix os-simple-tenant-usage result order

nova usage-list can return incorrect results, having resources counted
twice. This only occurs when using the 2.40 microversion or later.

This microversion introduced pagination, which doesn't work properly.
Nova API will sort the instances using the tenant id and instance uuid,
but 'os-simple-tenant-usage' will not preserve the order when returning
the results.

For this reason, subsequent API calls made by the client will use the
wrong marker (which is supposed to be the last instance id), ending
up counting the same instances twice.

Change-Id: I6c7a67b23ec49aa207c33c38580acd834bb27e3c
Closes-Bug: #1796689

commit_message:
PY3: fix broken cast to long on py3

py3 doesn't support long type. we should use int instead.

Change-Id: I22f1afa5326554e0f99315d62c4ab41d904ad9f0

commit_message:
Remove the duplicated doc8 executa

the doc8 action run twice when run tox -edocs[1] and -epep8[2],
 that's unnecessary, the ps to update it.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/watcher-specs/blob/master/tox.ini#L28
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/watcher-specs/blob/master/tox.ini#L35

Change-Id: Ie3afd15f1deba5f3e18ca3cb6e85984da85ca4e8
Closes-Bug: #1799022

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

[{'created': '2018-10-09 17:18:21.000000000', 'message': 'Further performance tuning changes for Ceph

Change-Id: I4aefcb6e774cb3e1252e52ca6003cec495556467
'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 20:10:21.000000000', 'message': "Further performance tuning changes for Ceph

- Throttle down snap trimming as to lessen it's performance impact
(Setting just osd_snap_trim_priority isn't effective enough to throttle down the impact)
osd_snap_trim_sleep: 0.1 (default 1)
osd_pg_max_concurrent_snap_trims: 1 (default 2)

- Align filestore_merge_threshold with upstream Ceph values
(A negative number disables this function, no change in existing behavior)
filestore_merge_threshold: -10 (formerly -50, default 10)

- Increase RGW pool thread size for more concurrent connections
rgw_thread_pool_size: 1024 (default 100)

Change-Id: I4aefcb6e774cb3e1252e52ca6003cec495556467
"}, {'created': '2018-10-09 23:01:16.000000000', 'message': "Further performance tuning changes for Ceph

- Disable in-memory logs for the ms subsytem.
debug_ms: 0/0 (default 0/5)

- Formating cleanups

Change-Id: I4aefcb6e774cb3e1252e52ca6003cec495556467

commit_message:
Further performance tuning changes for Ceph

- Throttle down snap trimming as to lessen it's performance impact
(Setting just osd_snap_trim_priority isn't effective enough to throttle
down the impact)
osd_snap_trim_sleep: 0.1 (default 0)
osd_pg_max_concurrent_snap_trims: 1 (default 2)

- Align filestore_merge_threshold with upstream Ceph values
(A negative number disables this function, no change in behavior)
filestore_merge_threshold: -10 (formerly -50, default 10)

- Increase RGW pool thread size for more concurrent connections
rgw_thread_pool_size: 512 (default 100)

- Disable in-memory logs for the ms subsytem.
debug_ms: 0/0 (default 0/5)

- Formating cleanups

Change-Id: I4aefcb6e774cb3e1252e52ca6003cec495556467

Looks good. Just a question - the script isn't passed the network_data.yaml file using 
"--network-data".  Does that need to be passed?'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-16 06:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Looks good. Just a question - the script isn't passed the
 > network_data.yaml file using
 > "--network-data".  Does that need to be passed?

This playbook would use the network_data.yaml file located in the directory set as {{ tht_directory }}. Afaict that is controlled by a var set in defaults[1]?

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L130

Ideally we would have 'default_network_data:', similar to the default_roles_data[2]. And the logic added all over this repo to use the default unless it's overriden?


There seem to be no support for non-default network_data.yaml in this repo. So probably a follow up change to add such support to all aspects of this tooling would be appropriate.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L130
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L133'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-10-22 22:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-23 10:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add rocky specific parameters to custom NICs.

New NIC parameters were introduced in this review:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580236/
so during upgrade existing have to be updated with them.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605807/
Change-Id: Ia23922a9632d68c05ce0cc464ec34b3341aa378e

commit_message:
Disable puppet-5 jobs

We don't want Puppet5 testing in TripleO stable branches. It'll only be
supported in Stein and beyond.

Change-Id: Id55f5e9cadfb973004876e2bce92383988e25742

commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

Change-Id: I79d6f1be1a2efbdab78769817a97419556176a5a

and can run under python2 or 3.

commit_message:
Native zuulv3 tests

This finalises the ports of the legacy jobs to zuul native jobs.

The dib-setup-gate-mirrors role preconfigures the repo templates,
etc. for the openstack-ci-mirrors element.

The dib-functests role runs the tests as specified by dib_functests,
and can run under python2 or 3.

Change-Id: Ied67a31f0d31503d13eccad8662c29740c93f33e

commit_message:
Move several packages to bindep.txt

Move several parts of the "install_test_deps.sh" script into the more
standard bindep.txt.  This list is intentionally restricted as a first
step.

Developer documentation is updated to use bindep and clarified
slightly.

Change-Id: I7520902dc324d920a0c7c44a2d35fe49f9b05614

commit_message:
Add framework for tacker-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of tacker-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I7bb127fa10dd168ab24dd8c42013576f84eadfbb
Story: 2003657
Task: 26158

commit_message:
Disable puppet-5 jobs

We don't want Puppet5 testing in TripleO stable branches. It'll only be
supported in Stein and beyond.

Change-Id: Id55f5e9cadfb973004876e2bce92383988e25742
(cherry picked from commit daa67198c788765caf77a89fb27f2defdf016180)

commit_message:
Deprecate fping_path option

The config option fping_path is deprecated as of Rocky[1], we should
deprecate in puppet-nova.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/rocky.html

Change-Id: Ic1f4ac65cce683618f772c4d3333f123938c0aea
Closes-Bug: #1794301

commit_message:
vnc and spice keymap are deprecated

vnc_keymap and keymap options has been deprecated as per rocky release
notes[1], we should deprecate these in puppet-nova.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/rocky.html

Change-Id: Ia42632f4c67aeab387b98aafd9e0f89ad62eb850
Closes-Bug: #1794300

commit_message:
Add restrictions on updated_at when getting instance action records

If ``changes-before`` is less than ``changes-since`` in requested,
there will get empty data when querying in db, so add the limit of
these parameters. If ``changes-before`` < ``changes-since``, will
be returned 400.

Closes-Bug: #1796009
Change-Id: I44546bc9798708a48a250cc3a21bdbcabe2649e1

subject: Implement auth receipts spec
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-06 01:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-06 04:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-06 04:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-15 04:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-17 23:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-06-18 21:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-18 23:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-06-20 19:25:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)

Great work so far! My main thought is that there's clearly a lot of duplication between this and tokens, it would be nice if the common bits could be extracted out and shared somehow."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > Great work so far! My main thought is that there's clearly a lot of
 > duplication between this and tokens, it would be nice if the common
 > bits could be extracted out and shared somehow.

I'm inclined to leave that as a follow up. Mostly because looking at the code right now, and comparing the likes of the token/receipt provider/formatter code, it is both very similar, and quite different. Trying to make the overlap generic right now will likely end up a lot of effort for not that much savings in code when the two models are quite different (token is complex, receipt is a very simple payload).


Next step will be following up with your comments, and then the provider unit tests and some manual testing, hopefully this Friday."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-29 05:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-29 05:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-02 06:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-07-03 21:58:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Not done reviewing, but some basic things:

1) In the spec the example response has a required_auth_methods list, which seems like a hugely important part of the spec. I don't see that anywhere here and when I tried it out I didn't see that in the response. What happened to it?
2) Could you add a mention of the new receipt header in the api-ref in https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#authentication-and-token-management (could be in a followup patch if you prefer)? I recognize that there are currently pretty much zero MFA docs so I won't ask for detailed usage docs, though if you have time for that after feature freeze that would be super helpful :)"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 05:25:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Not done reviewing, but some basic things:
 > 
 > 1) In the spec the example response has a required_auth_methods
 > list, which seems like a hugely important part of the spec. I don't
 > see that anywhere here and when I tried it out I didn't see that in
 > the response. What happened to it?

*facepalm*

Yes that is missing. For something I made such an important part of the spec, I'm surprised I missed it. I focused too much on the payload content rather than the returned data with the 409 and somehow it slipped my mind entirely! Need to decide where to properly add that to the returned data because there is no point storing that in the payload.

 > 2) Could you add a mention of the new receipt header in the api-ref
 > in https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#authentication-and-token-management
 > (could be in a followup patch if you prefer)? I recognize that
 > there are currently pretty much zero MFA docs so I won't ask for
 > detailed usage docs, though if you have time for that after feature
 > freeze that would be super helpful :)

Full MFA docs in followup patch for sure, but a note in API ref for now makes sense."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 06:30:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Yes that is missing. For something I made such an important part of
 > the spec, I'm surprised I missed it. I focused too much on the
 > payload content rather than the returned data with the 409 and
 > somehow it slipped my mind entirely!

401* not 409 :/ not sure why I wrote 409."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:43:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

The doc change is probably a little more verbose than needed, and maybe in a too prominent place, but once we add more MFA examples and documentation on how to use it, I expect there will be enough adoption to treat it as a common auth case.

But beyond that change, and potentially an example of an auth receipt being returned, I don't think other doc changes are needed just yet."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 09:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-05 09:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-06 01:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-06 01:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Docs changes moved to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580535/'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-07-06 18:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(27 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-07-09 19:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

I walked through some of this and highlighted a few of my concerns.

The biggest thing that catches my eye is the duplication of patterns between what is being proposed and the token provider API. While the token provider code might work for solving this problem, I'm very hesitant to copy/paste it for this. I think we should make sure we start from a fresh slate and really ask ourselves if that's how we want to design this specific feature. The token provider API has been undergoing refactors since Ocata [0], some of which were undocumented (specification-wise) before that (Morgan worked on cleaning this stuff up before I did). We're just now getting to the point where we have the opportunity to really clean things up and make them maintainable. I'd hate for the auth receipts implementation to suffer from the same patterns that confused and frustrated us in the past.

I also think we can break this patch up a bit. If we're designing a new manager layer for auth receipts, we have a good seam to break the proposal into two or more patches (e.g. one for the managers + test, another that exposes the API, et cetera). I guess what I'm trying to get at it - can we build a series of patches from the ground up with the last patch in the chain exposing the API to users? If you find another way to do it that's great, too. Just thinking about ways we can make this easier for reviewers.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ocata/token-provider-cleanup.html"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-10 03:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-10 03:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

(15 comments)

Since this patch was heavily based on the token provider API (which itself is pointlessly confusing), I'm going to hold off on this patch until the token provider API refactors are done. Then I'll update this to match, so the two follow the same pattern for the most part."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 04:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

replaced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611230/'}]

commit_message:
Implement auth receipts spec

Adds a new model and provider for receipts which are
very similar to tokens (fernet based), and share the
same fernet mechanisms.

Adds changes to the auth controller layer to handle
the creation, validation, and consumptions of receipts
as part of the auth process.

bp: mfa-auth-receipt
Change-Id: I51ec6f0f9a5e9183cf776ab67facb2a80614a855

subject: Fix the heat-container-agent docker image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 20498, 'name': 'Spyros Trigazis', 'email': 'strigazi@gmail.com', 'username': 'strigazi'}, {'_account_id': 21222, 'name': 'Mohammad Nasir', 'email': 'digi_worx@yahoo.com'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-10-25 22:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-10-26 07:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-10-29 02:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-10-29 02:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 22:36:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix the heat-container-agent docker image

There are 2 fixes included in this patch:

1. A regression issue introduced by the multi region patch,
   see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579043 for more details.
   There is a missing bracket.
2. Issues in the Dockerfile of heat-container-agent. Some depedencies
   are renamed or we don't really need them. And because of the
   multi region bug, we need a new version for os-collect-config. So
   switching to pip from dnf is much eaiser than building a new RPM
   package for those python libs we care about. To be more clear,
   for the multi region issue, we need os-collect-config 9.1.0, and
   with dnf you can only find 5.0.0.

Task: 23099
Story: 2002768

Change-Id: I015af15dccd5fe622137c1f5fe042d3d29cc9a47
(cherry picked from commit 4751d328b171a71c4cde8e49bc53b8804b113349)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the heat-container-agent docker image

There are 2 fixes included in this patch:

1. A regression issue introduced by the multi region patch,
   see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579043 for more details.
   There is a missing bracket.
2. Issues in the Dockerfile of heat-container-agent. Some depedencies
   are renamed or we don't really need them. And because of the
   multi region bug, we need a new version for os-collect-config. So
   switching to pip from dnf is much eaiser than building a new RPM
   package for those python libs we care about. To be more clear,
   for the multi region issue, we need os-collect-config 9.1.0, and
   with dnf you can only find 5.0.0.

Task: 23099
Story: 2002768

Change-Id: I015af15dccd5fe622137c1f5fe042d3d29cc9a47
(cherry picked from commit 4751d328b171a71c4cde8e49bc53b8804b113349)

commit_message:
Fix the 'tox -e cover' command

The 'cover' environment broke after commit
1c1d23c72361509f50dadfaab7d12b4911bf7213 because it still use the
old 'testr' command (but we have switched to stestr).

Change-Id: I782f895329f64368c6fde3470a12514bbe563d87

subject: Append ip_resolve=4 to yum.conf to use ipv4 explicitly
messages:
[{'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-19 05:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-19 08:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this option generally applicable? What if some sites want to use IPv6 for DNS?'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:08:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Mark, u r right indeed, but in current ipv6 is not used widely， and I met some ipv6 problems myself, so I give this patch just to make newcomer's life easier."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree with mark, what if someone uses ipv6, this file is not overridable during build, so ipv6 people wont be able to build images.

Whats the issue you facing with ipv6?'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-20 08:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Eduardo, thanks for ur review. I encountered some yum mirror with ipv6 when building, u can also check it out here: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/kolla/tree/tools/setup_RedHat.sh#n82  , so what about make it an option in configure file?'}, {'account_id': 23942, 'date': '2018-10-28 11:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

IPv6 is increasingly popular'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-10-29 01:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-22 13:29:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for per-service rate limits

Rate limits on the server-side are per-service, but the rate limit in
the TaskManager is a single rate. Add support for a dict of rate limits,
keyed by service-type.

For backwards compat, a single rate given to TaskManager will be rate
expressed in seconds of delay between calls. Moving forward, the dict of
rates will express calls per second.

Expose the setting in Connection using the calls-per-second parameter.

Change-Id: If0ff77b43adc1f6f0bb1e7c08908930a95508b31
'}, {'created': '2018-09-24 12:42:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for per-service rate limits

Rate limits on the server-side are per-service, but the rate limit in
the TaskManager is a single rate. Add support for a dict of rate limits,
keyed by service-type.

For backwards compat, a single rate given to TaskManager will be rate
expressed in seconds of delay between calls. Moving forward, the dict of
rates will express calls per second.

Expose the setting in Connection using the calls-per-second parameter.

Change-Id: If0ff77b43adc1f6f0bb1e7c08908930a95508b31
'}, {'created': '2018-09-24 14:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for per-service rate limits

Rate limits on the server-side are per-service, but the rate limit in

commit_message:
Add support for per-service rate limits

Rate limits on the server-side are per-service, but the rate limit in
the TaskManager is a single rate. Add support for a dict of rate limits,
keyed by service-type.

The primary user interface should be passing rate to the Connection
constructor. That takes calls-per-second for both scalar and dict
versions of its rate parameter.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/612168/
Change-Id: If0ff77b43adc1f6f0bb1e7c08908930a95508b31

commit_message:
Fix epel repo rewrite, add to testing

It looks like epel-release switch from "mirrorlist" to "metalink"
(around release 7-10 Jun 2017 according to [1]).  Update our rewrite
matching to handle this "metalink" as well.

Add epel element to the centos7 (image-based) build for testing too

[1] https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=978473

Add epel element so it's tested during the centos7 functional test.

Change-Id: I2d6d4c2ec47bc69d2f16c96b5045b05c435a1af9

commit_message:
Add all_projects as a preferred alias for all_tenants

Now that we support both server-side and client-side names for
parameters, we can add an all_projects alias. We already use project_id
in resources instead of tenant_id.

Put in logic to only pass all_projects along to the underlying list if
it's True. That way we can easily use the interface with True/False and
only send query parameters when we need to. Pehaps we could enhance
QueryParameters to understand default values of parameters and that they
don't need to be sent?

Change-Id: I66117ab4c82d30ae3700e17f7598b3d3fbbac60d

commit_message:
Use dnf and python3 on platforms where these are default

Reworked after a revert that cause it to break on centos-7
if user had py3 already installed.

install_deps now runs all the time as we can trust it to detect missing
dependencies. For example previous test was missing to check for
missing 'git' or missing selinux bindings.

Based on e946eb52f40ff86c23aa4a67f4fe7e59d30d4129.

Change-Id: I7e8527c6ad708ad1fcccb81f2df4934bc61b91f9

The federation docs have **orphan:** in bold printed on the published
pages. The :orphan: directive isn't needed for anything, so remove it to
keep it from showing up in the rendered docs.

The Caching Layer docs use the :orphan: directive as well and don't have
this issue, but also don't seem to need it there, so remove it from
there as well.

Change-Id: Icea1a89e04e4c249ba1d78f95ff5a66b9a297284
"}]
commit_message:
Remove useless use of :orphan:

The federation docs have **orphan:** in bold printed on the published
pages. The :orphan: directive isn't needed for anything, so remove it to
keep it from showing up in the rendered docs.

The Caching Layer docs use the :orphan: directive as well and don't have
this issue, but also don't seem to need it there, so remove it from
there as well.

Change-Id: Icea1a89e04e4c249ba1d78f95ff5a66b9a297284

subject: Improve document 'openstack complete'
messages:
[{'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 00:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 00:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-10-18 04:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 06:54:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Steve,

I don't think we can assume there will be dependency, I agree to put it in one sentence, however I would not assume that:

~~~
 When installed via a package, the ``bash-completion`` package will also be installed,
~~~"}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 06:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Took a quick look at openstack client in RHEL:

(undercloud) [root@undercloud-0 ~]# rpm -qf $(which openstack)
python2-openstackclient-3.14.2-1.el7ost.noarch
(undercloud) [root@undercloud-0 ~]# yum deplist python2-openstackclient | grep bash
  dependency: /bin/bash
   provider: bash.x86_64 4.2.46-30.el7'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-10-18 14:59:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Took a quick look at openstack client in RHEL:
 > 
 > (undercloud) [root@undercloud-0 ~]# rpm -qf $(which openstack)
 > python2-openstackclient-3.14.2-1.el7ost.noarch
 > (undercloud) [root@undercloud-0 ~]# yum deplist python2-openstackclient
 > | grep bash
 > dependency: /bin/bash
 > provider: bash.x86_64 4.2.46-30.el7

alright, cool. let's combine it into one sentence, use whatever wording you think is appropriate"}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 23:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-18 23:23:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Steve,

How about now? What we are trying to say here, that yes most of the Linux distribution will have this dependency as you mention, however if the end user runs into problem that this dependency doesn't exists like in RHEL they should not panic and just install the package.

At the same time we are not mentioning any specific distribution as it might have change in future.

What do you think about it ?

~~~
It is highly recommended to install ``python-openstackclient`` from a package
(``apt-get`` or ``yum``). In some distributions the package ``bash-completion`` is shipped
as dependency, and the `openstack complete` command will be run as a post-install action,
however not every distribution include this dependency and you might need to install
``bash-completion`` package to enable autocomplete feature.
~~~"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-10-18 23:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Lgtm'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-19 01:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit ef045e76cec189796d5e48971b800a37bffc81ba'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-19 01:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 9e963a13193d366bcc0bb2aed66f0ba94475491c'}, {'account_id': 19521, 'date': '2018-10-19 01:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 5d1dc7b89396d14c1e3f660a14e0097b48541077'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-28 19:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Improve document 'openstack complete'

The openstack complete command requires bash-completion package
Without the relevant package the bash completion doesn't work.

Change-Id: I47c77f3e7efe112417d2b96936fcd0cafeb9442e
Closes-Bug: #1798493

commit_message:
Update release note version reference table

The table indicating the openstackclient release at the time of the
overall OpenStack release had not been updated since Pike. This adds
release versions for Queens and Rocky.

Change-Id: Icd9a72c2460fae3d1b714b6da473564e6c709ef6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update the Neutron CLI decoder document

The floatingip-disassociate mapping had 'port' instead of
'--port', also fixed a few places where 'unset' was missing
from some of the mappings.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I3b01db28dda674e9988176d496154fbd26e4449f

commit_message:
Remove etcd_legacy

This commit removes code that implemented deprecated etcd deployment
option. In the gates we're using etcd3 from openstack/devstack for a
long time now and that should be used by anyone else as well.

Closes-Bug: 1799468

Change-Id: I7fa9f79cb2dcb8f16e9329dc2d5928a544c4ca4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 16:56:28.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: cleanup status conditions for backup/restore APIs

The description for the backups API in both the v2 and v3
reference had a generic statement that only available volumes
can be backed up and restored, which is misleading since it
is possible to backup an in-use volume if the force parameter
is used.

This change drops the generic statement from the high-level
description and opts for per-API descriptions about the status
preconditions for backup and restore operations.

The v3 restore reference already mentioned the status precondition
so the only change to that is fixing the bullet list formatting.

Change-Id: Ib6c61af9ced2527884569fa15a848a215dd985b8
Closes-Bug: #1799499
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: cleanup status conditions for backup/restore APIs

The description for the backups API in both the v2 and v3
reference had a generic statement that only available volumes
can be backed up and restored, which is misleading since it
is possible to backup an in-use volume if the force parameter
is used.

This change drops the generic statement from the high-level
description and opts for per-API descriptions about the status
preconditions for backup and restore operations.

The v3 restore reference already mentioned the status precondition
so the only change to that is fixing the bullet list formatting.

Change-Id: Ib6c61af9ced2527884569fa15a848a215dd985b8
Closes-Bug: #1799499

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-27 22:32:39.000000000', 'message': 'Expose dnsmasq_pxe_filter/purge_dhcp_hostsdir opt

The purge_dhcp_hostsdir controls wheater Ironic will
purge the dhcp_hostdir on initialization.

When the directory is purged the dnsmasq service must
be restarted as well to ensure the DHCP server config
is in sync once the dhcp-hosts directory is populated
with new content. Depending on how services are
deployed, controlling the dnsmasq service is non-
trivial. (I.e containers or different hosts.)

Change-Id: Icc532115891c567dde20a28110bf08f54187c49f
Related-Bug: #1780421
(cherry picked from commit 524b391f24d01a05638293ae4eb8d4c414f2e93b)
'}]
commit_message:
Expose dnsmasq_pxe_filter/purge_dhcp_hostsdir opt

The purge_dhcp_hostsdir controls wheater Ironic will
purge the dhcp_hostdir on initialization.

When the directory is purged the dnsmasq service must
be restarted as well to ensure the DHCP server config
is in sync once the dhcp-hosts directory is populated
with new content. Depending on how services are
deployed, controlling the dnsmasq service is non-
trivial. (I.e containers or different hosts.)

Change-Id: Icc532115891c567dde20a28110bf08f54187c49f
Related-Bug: #1780421
(cherry picked from commit 524b391f24d01a05638293ae4eb8d4c414f2e93b)

commit_message:
Fix the zun-wsproxy group missing in site.yml

zun-wsproxy group is used in multinode[1], but it missing from
site.yml this PS to fix this.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/inventory/multinode#L676

Change-Id: I3b06f15dba5b6569202b038a28fb1a2728cffd25
Closes-Bug: #1799234

commit_message:
Fix installation issues for devstack

* fix dependency issue for test-requirements.txt.
  Use correct branch in checked out networking-odl git repository.

* pick master fix for sourcing l2 agent script.
  Change from: I2fed6177eb35749bebd4b75d60b189c2abdb0cdd

* pick fix for building sphinx docs.
  Change from: Ic910eed43c3b56dadbdcf120f2f6f9c491ab7bc7

Change-Id: I204e0e9c96e838f841264ee6490496da2a1d6c99
Partial-Bug: 1764371

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 18:43:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "flake8:" prefix where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I1af4eb8bef9d0d0e3aa3bbbfd66a2fcb8ab336cb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "flake8:" prefix where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I1af4eb8bef9d0d0e3aa3bbbfd66a2fcb8ab336cb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use python3 format syntax for citycloud

We don't use % substitutions, we use .format() substitutions.

Change-Id: Ia340d4fa3e72d379ea1ef2d6f71dc60fcdf5beb5

commit_message:
Add release file for fedora 28

- Fedora 28 based deploys
- Changes to make it work using the standalone f28 job

After a passed run at a repro we were using 'consistent' for
tripleo_dlrn and 'current' for rdo_dlrn that's why hashes are different,
but we will use them like this to ensure that it works.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/146?kanban-status=1447274

Change-Id: Ifa164280c3160ccb9c346ab24b8a9acfb900e5d8

[{'created': '2018-10-22 17:21:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7
(cherry picked from commit 1973a037c29b0fc8bf6347771ed930726d1648f5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7
(cherry picked from commit 1973a037c29b0fc8bf6347771ed930726d1648f5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 07:58:14.000000000', 'message': 'Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 10:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)

We can't use @retry decorator in our case because number of retries 
"self.device_scan_attempts" is not constant, it's passed in the constructor method.
I tried to create a global variable with initial value of the default "scan_attempts=DEVICE_SCAN_ATTEMPTS_DEFAULT" and pass it as decorator param @utils.retry(exceptions=exception.CommandExecutionFailed,
                 interval=2, retries=scan_attempts)
then in the object constructor I change the value of "scan_attempts" according to be :

global scan_attempts
scan_attempts = device_scan_attempts

this also didn't work because the decorator method would be get called before the constructor.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I think you could use the retry decorator if you put the code to be retried inside an internally defined method, but not sure if that would really improve a lot. This looks fine to me.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-10-08 18:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Retry executing command "nvme list" when fail

Only one NVMe connection can be active on the same Compute node, when
initiator side has more than one connection then new connection is made,
results of the new connected device is not instantaneous.

Fixing this issue requires retry and sleep when executing command
"nvme list" to retrieve the newly connected device.

Change-Id: I6b70140be7023770b83603de723d6d2de3ebb747
Closes-Bug: #1792313

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 19:55:41.000000000', 'message': 'PY3: Ensure rados.Object.write() writes byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) and rados.Ioctx.write(data)
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments. [1, 2]
Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write()
in VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 byte object.

Also update the corresponding unit test as Object.write() expects
a string rather than a dictionary. [1]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917
'}]
commit_message:
PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) [1] and rados.Ioctx.write(data) [2]
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments.
rados.Object.read() returns that data.

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 15:29:48.000000000', 'message': 'Expose dnsmasq_pxe_filter/purge_dhcp_hostsdir opt

The purge_dhcp_hostsdir controls wheater Ironic will
purge the dhcp_hostdir on initialization.

When the directory is purged the dnsmasq service must
be restarted as well to ensure the DHCP server config
is in sync once the dhcp-hosts directory is populated
with new content. Depending on how services are
deployed, controlling the dnsmasq service is non-
trivial. (I.e containers or different hosts.)

Change-Id: Icc532115891c567dde20a28110bf08f54187c49f
Related-Bug: #1780421
'}]
commit_message:
Expose dnsmasq_pxe_filter/purge_dhcp_hostsdir opt

The purge_dhcp_hostsdir controls wheater Ironic will
purge the dhcp_hostdir on initialization.

When the directory is purged the dnsmasq service must
be restarted as well to ensure the DHCP server config
is in sync once the dhcp-hosts directory is populated
with new content. Depending on how services are
deployed, controlling the dnsmasq service is non-
trivial. (I.e containers or different hosts.)

Change-Id: Icc532115891c567dde20a28110bf08f54187c49f
Related-Bug: #1780421

[{'created': '2018-10-27 15:04:22.000000000', 'message': "Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra cinder-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-cinder - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-cinder job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Change-Id: I347c4a20dd4c918efefbd73279efbe9ee09904e8
"}]
commit_message:
Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra cinder-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-cinder - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-cinder job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Change-Id: I347c4a20dd4c918efefbd73279efbe9ee09904e8

commit_message:
Ensure that the flavor/network facts are available to all targets

Currently the registered result for the flavor creation is
only available on localhost. To ensure that it is available
on all hosts we first create it using the designated service
host, then fetch the details and set a fact for all hosts.

We do the same for the management network fact.

In order to achieve this, shade needs to be present on the
target host, so we add it into the octavia venv. We also make
sure that the octavia service account is used, because that's
where the flavor and network objects were created and only that
account has access to them.

Change-Id: I85b533dbb5fa29382dc615b584b21ff1a5d67a46
(cherry picked from commit e0a69d0bda3f55fdaf1e4cdb40baffe3a638d201)

[{'created': '2018-10-22 13:41:55.000000000', 'message': "[ci] Manage tox job manually

Patch Ia56cba58c87aa48de3e8e3f3d28f6252f7dcd7c3 introduced a new role
'ensure-python' which checks for installed python version before our
pre-run playbook can install not-default versions. Such change broke our
py34 job.

To fix the issue, let's do not use base global 'tox' playbook and
implement the custom one.

Change-Id: Ia69d36670ff07079c82c9b1fef54d8ade62c7c7b

commit_message:
[ci] Manage tox job manually

Patch Ia56cba58c87aa48de3e8e3f3d28f6252f7dcd7c3 introduced a new role
'ensure-python' which checks for installed python version before our
pre-run playbook can install not-default versions. Such change broke our
py34 job.

To continue checking Python 3.4 and ensure that everything is done as we
wish let's do not use global 'tox' job and implement the custom one.

The new rally-tox-base job checks tox.ini for required python version
and installs it via 'apt'. Also, there is new post playbook which
publishes the results of execution.

Change-Id: Ia69d36670ff07079c82c9b1fef54d8ade62c7c7b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 13:01:15.000000000', 'message': 'test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve
performance by copying files directly on the destination instead of
creating intermediate ones first.

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2
'}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve
performance by copying files directly on the destination instead of
creating intermediate ones first.

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-27 15:06:08.000000000', 'message': "Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra mistral-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-mistral - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-mistral job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Change-Id: I8e00bdb72d2ad6add58623e7335e1df11f5511d1
"}]
commit_message:
Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra mistral-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-mistral - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-mistral job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Change-Id: I8e00bdb72d2ad6add58623e7335e1df11f5511d1

commit_message:
Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra murano-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-murano - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-murano job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Change-Id: Id85019dcf7ace199fc1f5b606e616f9e1997d0bf

commit_message:
Use rally-task directly

There's no need to add an extra neutron-rally-task job, the parent of
the current job - named rally-task-neutron - uses all the settings that
this job does.

Thus, use rally-task-neutron job directly and remove the now obsolete
job definition.

Copy over list of irrelevant files from tempest jobs.

Change-Id: Ib529cff9c0e0a5bd1e4638944a1adf19e9f9ac10

commit_message:
Stop running shade tests

We updated shade to not be a subclass of openstacksdk and instead just
be a frozen maint-mode library. We don't need to co-gate with it anymore
then, as sdk changes should not have impact on shade.

Change-Id: If808a3e6b94e93c5b5934da8c91e06d8b6ded1b9

commit_message:
Don't pass disk_format or container_format to image task upload

In task upload we update the image properties after importing the image.
Attempting to set disk_format/container_format at that point is not the
right choice in life.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613438
Change-Id: I3b086e83514a71cea0bb4119d75c48c153099141

subject: Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-26 18:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-27 13:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 18:54:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "noqa" usage where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I331b851310f62d6be925203e1f36cd67737996be
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "noqa" usage where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I331b851310f62d6be925203e1f36cd67737996be
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I405b64b8067e43309257d50a5c2acc915c789d24

commit_message:
Lint all the generated playbook after standalone deployment.

This task default to false, and should be changed in the featureset.

It ansible-lint all generated playbook and enable detection of error
in any playbook, even those that are not used in the
deployment (upgrade, update, ffu tasks for instances)

The current version only fails on syntax error (wrong ansible module
name mainly) as currently the generated playbooks misses name in a lot
of tasks.

When this is fixed we can enable error of any lint error.

Change-Id: Ibe0bd47cc88063f71c405b408342426888fbf88d

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I68e5fd1b893bf716f6cfc08d80a36fbb07f635f7
(cherry picked from commit 8350c74fb84ce71cd754be4aa99953d8d59df1e6)

[{'created': '2018-10-25 07:44:03.000000000', 'message': '[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)
'}]
commit_message:
[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)

commit_message:
use context manager from neutron-lib

The neutron.db.api.context_manager already references neutron-lib's
context manager; so consumers of it are already using neutron-lib. This
patch switches neutron's references to the context_manager over to
use neutron-lib's directly rather than that in neutron.db.api.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I97120faeec73690592ed21a5ec3c6202f61e1429

We didn't put the user_id in the request spec until rocky, so any move operations on instances created before rocky wouldn't have RequestSpec.user_id set.

> under what circumstances can they be legitimately different?

If a non-admin user created an instance and then an admin user moved it (live migrate, evacuate, etc)."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-19 17:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Use RequestSpec.user_id in scheduler.utils.claim_resources

We now have the RequestSpec.user_id since change:

  I3e174ae76931f8279540e92328c7c36a7bcaabc0

So we can try to use that in claim_resources() if it's
set, otherwise continue to fallback on the RequestContext.

Change-Id: I2f9752b0bf7e616556035b58853c57f964c2d5e9

commit_message:
Remove airship-armada jobs, as they are all in project

This patch set removes all the jobs for airship-armada.

Armada already has all of these templates/jobs in its own
in-tree .zuul.yaml: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611012/1/.zuul.yaml

Depends-On: Iab6b5594b341761a7202ae2d8a5a24ef48b6b654
Change-Id: I1203714e6e0907b902d07267cbfced722e2a200c

subject: GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH in tox passenv and devstack playbook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23186, 'name': 'Felipe Monteiro', 'email': 'felipe.carneiro.monteiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipe.monteiro'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-03 09:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-10-03 13:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If the gabbi-tempest job requires the tempest-gabbi plugin, I think it should be defined in the tempest-gabbi repository, not here.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-03 13:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> If the gabbi-tempest job requires the tempest-gabbi plugin, I think
 > it should be defined in the tempest-gabbi repository, not here.

That probably makes sense, yeah, but for the time being I was just trying to make sure it would even work.

And even if the job is defined in gabbi-tempest, the tox.ini changes will still be required.

Mind you, if I had my druthers, support for gabbi-tempest could be baked into tempest and then you could set GABB_TEMPEST_PATH and be "done".'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-10-03 13:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > If the gabbi-tempest job requires the tempest-gabbi plugin, I
 > think
 > > it should be defined in the tempest-gabbi repository, not here.
 > 
 > That probably makes sense, yeah, but for the time being I was just
 > trying to make sure it would even work.

Right, so far it's WIP.

 > 
 > And even if the job is defined in gabbi-tempest, the tox.ini
 > changes will still be required.

Sure, that's something that needs to stay in the final change.


 > Mind you, if I had my druthers, support for gabbi-tempest could be
 > baked into tempest and then you could set GABB_TEMPEST_PATH and be
 > "done".

Usually tempest plugins defines their own jobs in the repository, so if the gabbi-tempest plugin is going to be self-contained as it seems, there is no real reason to have it inside tempest.git (unless I misread the "baked into tempest" part).'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-15 16:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-16 03:32:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for submitting this; I am happy to see gabbi-tempest gaining traction. I myself have used gabbi quite a lot and think it's a wonderful tool. However, I'm curious whether there's any policy against supporting non-OpenStack services for things like this? I personally don't see any issue with this patch set and am OK to +2 it, but would like to ensure that this falls within OpenStack governance. That being said, I'm not sure if there are plans to include gabbi underneath the OpenStack umbrella?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-16 10:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thanks for submitting this; I am happy to see gabbi-tempest gaining
 > traction. I myself have used gabbi quite a lot and think it's a
 > wonderful tool. However, I'm curious whether there's any policy
 > against supporting non-OpenStack services for things like this? I
 > personally don't see any issue with this patch set and am OK to +2
 > it, but would like to ensure that this falls within OpenStack
 > governance. That being said, I'm not sure if there are plans to
 > include gabbi underneath the OpenStack umbrella?

We use tons of non-OpenStack tools throughout OpenStack, in testing and other code, gabbi is simply a tool, like tox or unittest, so there should be no issues with governance.

The tempest plugin (gabbi-tempest) does need to be within openstack infra in order for zuul to use any jobs it defines. We could consider making it official in some form if that's desired, but I would think that would be in response to it being useful, not in advance thereof. I think within QA would be a natural home, but some reluctance to "officially" support gabbi has been expressed in the past.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-19 05:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-23 10:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611678/ demonstrates this doing the desired thing. Would be great if we could get this merged.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-26 02:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 09:25:24.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Create a gabbi-tempest zuul job

The job uses the gabbi-tempest plugin to enable the creation of
child jobs that enable easy tempest tests with gabbit files.

The desired workflow is that a child of the gabbi-tempest job
would set the gabbi_tempest_path var to a directory containing
the gabbi yaml files that are to be tested. The yaml files
would normally be hosted by a project (e.g.,
placement/gate/gabbits).

This is going to take some work to get clean, but it the hope
is that this will provide a very simple way for people to
add API tests, based on gabbi, with minimal work required in
tempest itself or tempest plugins.

Change-Id: I5aa890baa489f434b95d21e4e618f5202ac550e4
'}, {'created': '2018-10-15 16:29:10.000000000', 'message': "GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH in tox passenv and devstack playbook

The in-progress gabbi-tempest plugin [1] uses an environment
variable, GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH, to identify directories in
which to find the gabbi [2] tests that will be run. This
will be used by a future zuul job (hosted by the plugin)
that will automate gabbi-based service testing as described
in https://anticdent.org/gabbi-in-the-gate.html .

By setting the environment in the devstack-tempest playbook
we avoid needing to duplicate the playbook: we can use
it directly and have less risk of plays diverging. The
calling job (which doesn't use the environment key) can
simply set a var.

[1] https://github.com/cdent/gabbi-tempest and
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610628/
[2] https://gabbi.readthedocs.io

Change-Id: I5aa890baa489f434b95d21e4e618f5202ac550e4

commit_message:
GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH in tox passenv and devstack playbook

The gabbi-tempest plugin uses an environment variable,
GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH, to identify directories in which to
find the gabbi [1] tests that will be run. This will be
used by a forthcoming zuul job [2] (hosted by the plugin)
that will automate gabbi-based service testing as described
in https://anticdent.org/gabbi-in-the-gate.html .

By setting the environment in the devstack-tempest playbook
we avoid needing to duplicate the playbook: we can use
it directly and have less risk of plays diverging. The
calling job (which doesn't allow the "environment" key)
sets a "var" which then sets the environment variable.

[1] https://gabbi.readthedocs.io
[2] https://review.openstack.org/611678

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/611678
Change-Id: I5aa890baa489f434b95d21e4e618f5202ac550e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 05:29:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix up the test for .ismount

We kept hitting a floating error in the test, where fist ismount
in the test succeeds, while it should fail. As it turned out,
the return of getdtemp was the plain /tmp. So, a previous test
created /tmp/.ismount and the subsequent runs failed on it.
Re-generating the root filesystem (e.g. by a container) fixes
the problem, but still, there's no need to do this. This change
tightens the test up by placing the .ismount into a subdirectory
of the test directory instead of the global /tmp.

Change-Id: I006ba1f69982ef7513db3508d691723656f576c9
"}, {'created': '2018-10-26 05:31:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix up the test for .ismount

We kept hitting a floating error in the test, where fist ismount
in the test succeeds, while it should fail. As it turned out,
the return of gettempdir was the plain /tmp. So, a previous test
created /tmp/.ismount and the subsequent runs failed on it.
Re-generating the root filesystem (e.g. by a container) fixes
the problem, but still, there's no need to do this. This change
tightens the test up by placing the .ismount into a subdirectory
of the test directory instead of the global /tmp.

Change-Id: I006ba1f69982ef7513db3508d691723656f576c9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up the test for .ismount

We kept hitting a floating error in the test, where fist ismount
in the test succeeds, while it should fail. As it turned out,
the return of gettempdir was the plain /tmp. So, a previous test
created /tmp/.ismount and the subsequent runs failed on it.
Re-generating the root filesystem (e.g. by a container) fixes
the problem, but still, there's no need to do this. This change
tightens the test up by placing the .ismount into a subdirectory
of the test directory instead of the global /tmp.

Change-Id: I006ba1f69982ef7513db3508d691723656f576c9

[{'created': '2018-10-19 22:52:23.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Specifically call out Non-Code Contribution

Its not the most clear to people looking at the guide
that there are other ways to contribute other than code.
There are sections on being an operator and a user, but there
are other types of non code contribution than those. This is
the first step in enumerating these other types of contribution.

This patch also adds a section on mentoring to the common directory.
In the future, it might be good to add it to the indices for other
sections of the guide- code& docs, operators, etc- in a follow up patch
but at this point the focus is populating the non-code contribution
activities list.

Story: 2001437
Task: 6148

Story: 2004131
Task: 27577

commit_message:
Specifically call out Non-Code Contribution

Its not the most clear to people looking at the guide
that there are other ways to contribute other than code.
There are sections on being an operator and a user, but there
are other types of non code contribution than those. This is
the first step in enumerating these other types of contribution.

This patch also adds a section on mentoring to the common directory.
In the future, it might be good to add it to the indices for other
sections of the guide- code& docs, operators, etc- in a follow up patch
but at this point the focus is populating the non-code contribution
activities list.

Story: 2001437
Task: 6148

Story: 2004131
Task: 27577

Change-Id: I7b64ea62572749c0fe097766d12d5655df79b7c0

[{'created': '2018-10-18 03:50:19.000000000', 'message': 'Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will raise a HTTPConflict(409).

commit_message:
Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will be raise a HTTPBadRequest(400).

Change-Id: Ib3cc95a10870822b9f597d66007699fb40908b61
Closes-bug: #1798503

commit_message:
Deprecate use of v2 roles client in rbac_utils.py

This patch set deprecates use of the v2 roles client for
role overriding operations. This is because the Keystone v2 API
is deprecated and slated for removal, so Patrole's use of the
v2 Tempest roles client is also deprecated and will be
removed in a future release. Patrole will only support the v3 Tempest
roles client for role overriding operations in the future.

Change-Id: I9b201677cf8244b25f3cc8ea3b48a95b2b83b95e

commit_message:
Remove Fedora Job for Kata project

We are having issues running Fedora 28 under vexxhost. Remove
the Fedora job until we find a solution.
The issue is documented in:
https://github.com/kata-containers/tests/issues/418

Change-Id: I3161a86a34666c817c6029dae7b78901f637600e
Signed-off-by: Salvador Fuentes <salvador.fuentes@intel.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-25 14:54:09.000000000', 'message': "Guard cluster operations until sufficient OSD's booted

Ensure that broker requests are not processed and that client
access keys are not issued until the expected number of OSD's
have been bootstrapped into the cluster.

This depends on presentation of the number of bootstrapped
OSD's from the ceph-osd charm (see Depends-On).

For upgraders, keys will have already been issued so there
should be no impact on existing access to the Ceph cluster;
The ceph-osd units will present the required relation data
post upgrade at which point the charm will mark the cluster
as ready for service and continue to process and pending
requests.
