commit_message:
Guard cluster operations until sufficient OSD's booted

Ensure that broker requests are not processed and that client
access keys are not issued until the expected number of OSD's
have been bootstrapped into the cluster.

This depends on presentation of the number of bootstrapped
OSD's from the ceph-osd charm (see Depends-On).

For upgraders, keys will have already been issued so there
should be no impact on existing access to the Ceph cluster;
The ceph-osd units will present the required relation data
post upgrade at which point the charm will mark the cluster
as ready for service and continue to process and pending
requests.

Change-Id: Id67e13c176fc8fd4953ba7c2cf7e33252810940c
Closes-Bug: 1794878
(cherry picked from commit ed99bd2b5708d0494a9139e6805a03940b41eefb)

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-24549 : FAILURE in 2h 35m 43s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:59:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Does this result in a HTTP 5xx code at the moment? If so, that's not clear to me. I thought we couldn't change API behavior without a microversion unless it resolved an error. Assuming this doesn't result in such an error, how does this qualify?

As the commit message (and bug) says, if you specify changes-before with a value less than changes-since, you'll get nothing back. It's like querying the DB to say, give me everything between tomorrow (start) and yesterday (end) - it doesn't make sense. It was just missed when adding the (recent) microversion and does not warrant a microversion since it's just a usage mistake to begin with."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-25 01:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thanks Matt.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-25 01:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

and we just merge this feature month ago, I think it is ok for not having a microversion. so I +2, waiting for Stephen reply'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > Does this result in a HTTP 5xx code at the moment? If so, that's
 > not clear to me. I thought we couldn't change API behavior without
 > a microversion unless it resolved an error. Assuming this doesn't
 > result in such an error, how does this qualify?
 > 
 > As the commit message (and bug) says, if you specify changes-before
 > with a value less than changes-since, you'll get nothing back. It's
 > like querying the DB to say, give me everything between tomorrow
 > (start) and yesterday (end) - it doesn't make sense. It was just
 > missed when adding the (recent) microversion and does not warrant a
 > microversion since it's just a usage mistake to begin with.

Yes, I read both. I recall people having been pretty firm with the "must raise HTTP 5xx to not need a microversion" rule in the past, but this suggests that is not such a hard rule. If so, that's fine, it's just not the model I had in my head. As an anecdote, I recall gmann talking about adding additional validation to some other endpoints in the recent past (handling things like typos or non-existent parameters, iirc) and was certain that a microversion was stated as a requirement. This suggests that may not be the case.

In any case, I'm not -1. More trying to match my rules around these reviews to the rules everyone else has. As you were.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-26 18:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add restrictions on updated_at when getting migrations

If ``changes-before`` is less than ``changes-since`` in requested,
there will get empty data when querying in db, so add the limit of
these parameters. If ``changes-before`` < ``changes-since``, will
be returned 400.

Closes-Bug: #1796008
Change-Id: I2a39ac5a9fe969d383099b4e766c46ad05d9f67c

commit_message:
Ensure NRPE checks are updated under config-change

Reorder the config-changed hook to ensure that NRPE checks are
updated across all units, not just the lead unit, when charm
options are changed by an operator.

Change-Id: Ia75471ea9781ecee115a837db89a6d597e82d512
Closes-Bug: 1790544

commit_message:
DVR: Avoid address scope rules for dvr_no_external agents

All FloatingIP for DVR_NO_EXTERNAL agents will be configured
in the SNAT Namespace. So there is no need to configure the
address scope related routes in the router namespace when the
agent is configured as DVR_NO_EXTERNAL.

Change-Id: I009dae9e7f485641f2f19dce8dd575da04bfb044
Related-Bug: #1753434

[{'created': '2018-10-19 16:20:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: agent_alive() KeyError problem

The agent_alive() method may fail with a unhandled KeyError when it
tries to determine whether an agent that has been already deleted from
the AgentStats tracker is alive or not.

This patch handles the problem and in those cases it will just report
the agent as "dead".

Closes-Bug: #1796878
Change-Id: Ieee97721af09474fbbd4f03ab74da409f1e12833
(cherry picked from commit 062a05ade43def985dcd735f13460a973a594939)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: agent_alive() KeyError problem

The agent_alive() method may fail with a unhandled KeyError when it
tries to determine whether an agent that has been already deleted from
the AgentStats tracker is alive or not.

This patch handles the problem and in those cases it will just report
the agent as "dead".

Closes-Bug: #1796878
Change-Id: Ieee97721af09474fbbd4f03ab74da409f1e12833
(cherry picked from commit 062a05ade43def985dcd735f13460a973a594939)

commit_message:
Fix Python3.5+ issues

The driver was relying on attributes such as "im_class" that does not
exist in Python3+ anymore.

This patch fixes those problems and also add a new job in the gate to
exercise tempest with Python3.5+ so those errors don't sneak in the
code again.

Closes-Bug: #1791925
Change-Id: I8686288bd4493f56b25e99281999bdd5e1296f8c
(cherry picked from commit 7c03ec170e24b93a276d8d9e46771f834c232ebf)

commit_message:
Add statement explaining "tips" job configuration

The configuration of the periodic "tips" jobs in .zuul.yaml may
be confusing, particularly after a stable branch is cut.   Add a
comment explaining what we're doing and why to reduce confusion.

Change-Id: I7bf676ac972af835c7a6b8d04815629752685765
(cherry picked from commit ad46c752ef66f552a29866432edd252eff0bd125)

commit_message:
Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: If80ead2796c370b9539a0d7dd12bb8d35de8abcf
(cherry picked from commit 93636d6e25938617c9b1a58c737540c62d7f27c3)

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This changet  removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA compatible and may be pulled
into tree should we deem it necessary.

In addition, it re-orders some tasks for consistency with other roles.

Change-Id: I124873a6ab96aa95f886ce146d28e7340c90d40d

commit_message:
Stop arbitrary shutting down services

It looks like services are shut down for no reason if we're running
a migration which can mean they will never be started back up if
a playbook fails.

This patch stops shutting down services for no reason as most likely
the service will be restarted after the packages change.

Change-Id: If4214abf928711c364d7962a0369db4a69a4440f

Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I29025dea82ff8a0bcd03cbcf39ae7b34470f0a89

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: Ibb9cf561ee5bc2c8fa57fa53a0692269b86079cd
(cherry picked from commit 659c6b92f81760d5173d5c19e142e5296c7c451c)

commit_message:
Make Queens and Rocky share same conf template

The original patch for this bug fixed the problem for
rocky only but queens also suffers from the same
problem. Since the only diff between the P and R
templates is this change, move it into Q so that
Q and R will both get the fix.

Change-Id: Ib4573aa925cb1b3b9e1fa04e8a3c5bf611223c25
Related-Bug: #1788631

commit_message:
Cleanup nova distro package install lists

The distro install package lists included virtual packages to install
everything nova, packages for deprecated services (cells v1,
nova-network, nova-volume), and packages specific
to hypervisors currently unsupported by OSA (xen).

nova-compute and serialconsole specific packages been moved out to
nova_service_extra_distro_packages.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/612614
Change-Id: I8fb5e17598b24c2399fbff7ac29957b73042329d

Wow this one could cause a much of work.

We'll need to update the mailing list on what this means and how to take a deliverable "back" to maintained if the current stable core team has that capacity, or forward to "unmaintained" for projects that do not subscribe the the EM concept.

For projects that are okay with the idea of EM opening the gates for new stable core teams to be formed.

It's equal parts exciting and nerve-wracking ;P'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-18 20:38:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thread started in the dev, sigs and ops lists:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/134810.html

Regarding what Tony said, there is no going back from 'extended maintenance' with separate core teams and all that. Part of the deal with extended maintenance is it's still around while it still works and people maintain it, with the same core team as the maintained branches, but once it's not maintained then it transitions to 'unmaintained' or 'end of life'."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-22 00:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-10-26 00:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Add memcache flushing handler on db migrations

Flushing cache when schema changes occur to avoid drift between
what might be cached and what keystone queries expect.

Given that this is a workaround which is only usually required
in major upgrades (and should really be handled in process by
keystone itself), we make the execution optional so that it can
be set to happen only on major upgrades.

To prevent test breakage as happened in master, we combine the
two master patches into one for the backport:

https://review.openstack.org/608066
https://review.openstack.org/613256

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613291
Change-Id: Ibf8f3dd60d6f3c446a14dc8228fa005f12fcc840
Closes-Bug: 1793389

subject: WIP: Allow admin project scoped tokens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-26 13:22:13.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Allow admin project scoped tokens

This change aims to set the tempest admin_domain_scope option under
identity to the default value, false[1], so that v3 API tests can
validate tokens scoped to projects[2].

The old behavior forced every token to be domain scoped which makes
tests like[3] difficult to test in an admin test case.

I believe there is more work that is needed, like additions to the
accounts.yaml[4] file so that we can specify project_domain_name and
user_domain_name fields. Setting these domain values are especially
useful for pre-provisioned credential provider users.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/sampleconf.html
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/24/593124/3/experimental/legacy-tempest-dsvm-identity-v3-test$
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593124/3/tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_tokens.py
[4] http://logs.openstack.org/24/593124/3/experimental/legacy-tempest-dsvm-identity-v3-test$

Change-Id: I269fbb1ed3eb1a29b94e7b67160ce36722a27846
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Allow admin project scoped tokens

This change aims to set the tempest admin_domain_scope option under
identity to the default value, false[1], so that v3 API tests can
validate tokens scoped to projects[2].

The old behavior forced every token to be domain scoped which makes
tests like[3] difficult to test in an admin test case.

I believe there is more work that is needed, like additions to the
accounts.yaml[4] file so that we can specify project_domain_name and
user_domain_name fields. Setting these domain values are especially
useful for pre-provisioned credential provider users.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/sampleconf.html
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/24/593124/3/experimental/legacy-tempest-dsvm-identity-v3-test$
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593124/3/tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_tokens.py
[4] http://logs.openstack.org/24/593124/3/experimental/legacy-tempest-dsvm-identity-v3-test$

Change-Id: I269fbb1ed3eb1a29b94e7b67160ce36722a27846

commit_message:
Fixup functions for 5.5.7+

Recent changes to Puppet (5.5.7+) has broken some of the legacy function
items we were doing in puppet-nova. We'll likely need to update all the
functions to the new syntax but for now this change is to address
current issues.

Change-Id: If1d675cec6fe64e8a812fb638078b0ab1c66b5de
Closes-Bug: #1799757
(cherry picked from commit 3d877926f09d9c0c0f331025256c4b55214c1269)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 11:00:53.000000000', 'message': 'Restart lxc-dnsmasq after clearing iptables rules

When a functional test is run against the same host more than once and
iptables rules are managed by lxc-dnsmasq the rules that lxc-dnsmasq
created during the first run are removed, preventing containers from
accessing external networks.

Add a notify to restart the service and recreate the rules.

Change-Id: Ia3b39c7f81d24de10fe23cb000b1253f4b3dcbfd
(cherry picked from commit cd8de5c66d0b95eac36f42173e13c05e89dab742)
'}]
commit_message:
Restart lxc-dnsmasq after clearing iptables rules

When a functional test is run against the same host more than once and
iptables rules are managed by lxc-dnsmasq the rules that lxc-dnsmasq
created during the first run are removed, preventing containers from
accessing external networks.

Add a notify to restart the service and recreate the rules.

Change-Id: Ia3b39c7f81d24de10fe23cb000b1253f4b3dcbfd
(cherry picked from commit cd8de5c66d0b95eac36f42173e13c05e89dab742)

commit_message:
Add more documentation for online_data_migrations CLI

This is a follow up to commit c4c6dc736 to clarify some
confusing comments in the code, add more comments in
the actual runtime code, and also provide an example
in the CLI man page docs along with an explanation of
the output, specifically for the case that $found>0
but done=0 and what that means.

Change-Id: I0691caab2c44d3189504c54e51bb263ecdc5d1d2
Related-Bug: #1794364

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Additional changes were made to normalise the tests with
most other roles and ensure that the same bridge/network
configuration is applied.

Change-Id: I42d691a2f01918932006984f9f68af9df1c7e41f
(cherry picked from commit 79c252fb268d9472076834e140135158d6a8253d)

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

The container4 host vars were removed because container4
is not present in the inventory. It has been left over
by mistake in previous refactoring.

Change-Id: I5f86e3bfad95e80c8d2d98237f44883643780df9
(cherry picked from commit b7cb5188a16dfb4b993c2b6b750e78aeb6104ae3)

Add instack-undercloud job

We removed the instack-undercloud job for anything newer than Rocky. We
still need to run this job on the instack-undercloud project so let's
add it in here.

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I9918c812f2ecc509cd65c463599bd8a2df4165e3
Story: #2004073
Task: #27459

[{'created': '2018-08-10 08:50:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP Disable management plugin by default

We do not enable it on the overcloud because service_manage is
false there and the plugin gets enabled when both admin_enable (defaults to
true) and service_manage (defaults to true) are true

Let's disable this as we do not want to support this plugin
and it seems it causes problems in certain environments.
NB: WIP as I am not sure yet what/why it is creating an issue in this
specific env.

Change-Id: Iecefc3513cf1582ede3178607e5203e6311cb8fe
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Disable management plugin by default

We do not enable it on the overcloud because service_manage is
false there and the plugin gets enabled when both admin_enable (defaults to
true) and service_manage (defaults to true) are true

Let's disable this as we do not want to support this plugin
and it seems it causes problems in certain environments.
NB: WIP as I am not sure yet what/why it is creating an issue in this
specific env.

Change-Id: Iecefc3513cf1582ede3178607e5203e6311cb8fe

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5465c1cbf9ba452ead2f863b9b3b146775c049b8

[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-17 02:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-17 03:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/611218/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 01s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:26:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure how legit it is to update already released  release notes. Should ask Doug."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:37:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not sure how legit it is to update already released  release
 > notes. Should ask Doug.

Doug, could you please advise the best way to go about adding more information to our upgrade release notes for Rocky? mnaser reported a bug yesterday about info missing from our release notes regarding consoles and a live/rolling upgrade.

Is the best way to do this to edit the already released note and backport it to stable/rocky? Or should we propose a [stable only] new upgrade reno to stable/rocky to add more information? Or other? Thanks for your help."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-17 22:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-24365 : SUCCESS in 58m 25s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-10-17 23:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/611218/2 : FAILURE in 2h 00m 53s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-18 19:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-18 21:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-24405 : SUCCESS in 1h 26m 58s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-10-18 22:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/611218/3 : SUCCESS in 2h 15m 38s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think we'll just need to see how the backported release note update looks when it's built on stable. Does it re-create the same release note that went into the GA but now in the untagged patch release? Or does it modify the original release note in the GA notes?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:44:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

OK I guess the changes don't show up for master:

http://logs.openstack.org/18/611218/3/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/2709341/html/unreleased.html

Or in Rocky:

http://logs.openstack.org/18/611218/3/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/2709341/html/rocky.html

But maybe the changes will show up once this is backported. You could try that locally."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think we'll just need to see how the backported release note
 > update looks when it's built on stable. Does it re-create the same
 > release note that went into the GA but now in the untagged patch
 > release? Or does it modify the original release note in the GA
 > notes?

I had asked in #openstack-release [1] about whether it's OK to modify already released release notes and mordred and pabelanger said it's a use case builtin to reno. They pointed me to this presentation by dhellmann that explains how to do it and how it works:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tEOGJ_h0Lx0&t=19m52s

Sorry I didn't add a comment to this review soon after. I was meaning to take a look at the release note job output here first.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2018-10-18.log.html#t2018-10-18T17:32:38"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-25 00:04:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Hm, looks like the documentation says that modifications for already released release notes need to be proposed to the stable branch where they were originally added:

https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html#updating-stable-branch-release-notes

It also says if you accidentally add them to a later branch, they will show up in a later release where they shouldn't. But we don't see that happening in the build-openstack-releasenotes job output here. So maybe that part of the doc is outdated and reno does something automatically to hide notes on later branches.

I'm going to re-propose this for stable/rocky."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-26 18:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This should go direct to the stable branch and that is proposed here:

https://review.openstack.org/613174'}]

used if an operator is performing a live, rolling upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1798188

commit_message:
SUSE: Add system-user-nobody for Leap 15

The 'nobody' user and group is being used in several places so it's
best to make sure that it's present on every SUSE host instead of
creating it on demand.

Change-Id: Id42e514c3f961fa2dc68fdcad845597a74091b03

commit_message:
New Repo: OpenStack-Helm Docs

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the documentation that is currently spread
throughout the openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and
openstack-helm-infra repos.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611896/
Change-Id: Iba7b0dae27c66cacfb2ade2f30853e071cd63ad0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

Official projects should be releasing via the openstack/releases repo. Is there a reason the helm projects would not be doing that? We have a few exceptions due to tool-specific requirements, but if that is the case, it would be good to get that documented here in comments.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-25 06:14:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Giving WIP since we're waiting for comments..."}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-10-25 06:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-25 08:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

> Official projects should be releasing via the openstack/releases
 > repo. Is there a reason the helm projects would not be doing that?
 > We have a few exceptions due to tool-specific requirements, but if
 > that is the case, it would be good to get that documented here in
 > comments.

OpenStack-Helm is release independent and wishes to remain so, as a result (as far as I understand) the configuration here is correct?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-25 17:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That depends what you mean by release independent. One of the release models is "independent" which means they are released whenever needed, not tied at all to the overall OpenStack development cycles. Said another way, released, but not part of the ~6 month coordinated release.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-25 17:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > release models is "independent" which means they are released

 > development cycles. Said another way, released, but not part of the
 > ~6 month coordinated release.

Thanks for the clarification, the above is our intent. We have not yet achieved the point at which we feel appropriate to cut our 1st release.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-10-25 18:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> LGTM - could you make the change change to Helm Docs, please?

will do'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-25 18:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks Pete!'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-25 20:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-26 18:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
New Repo - OpenStack-Helm Images

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the dockerfiles that are spread throughout the
openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and openstack-helm-infra
repoisitories.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/611895
Change-Id: Ifd6b2c806567a082e0773795395f7f18d47f8ff9
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Move openstack-browbeat zuul jobs to project repository

Removing jobs from central config, and moving them to project
repository. Adding publish-to-pypi template to browbeat project.

Change-Id: I89523e0161f54da3254b4b92709d668dd63ed11f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613004

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 02:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add a hacking rule for deprecated assertion methods

Add a hacking rule for the following deprecated methods(*)
in Python 3.

* assertRegexpMatches
* assertNotRegexpMatches

[N361] assertRegex/assertNotRegex must be used instead of
       assertRegexpMatches/assertNotRegexpMatches.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Change-Id: Icfbaf26a7db6986820e264d1888982b985d613a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for deprecated assertion methods

Add a hacking rule for the following deprecated methods(*)
in Python 3.

* assertRegexpMatches
* assertNotRegexpMatches

[N361] assertRegex/assertNotRegex must be used instead of
       assertRegexpMatches/assertNotRegexpMatches.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Change-Id: Icfbaf26a7db6986820e264d1888982b985d613a1

commit_message:
api-ref: Remove unnecessary minimum microversion

A minimum microversion description that is the same as
the microversion the API is newly added is redundant
in parameters. So remove them.

Change-Id: I3e1ca88cac3a52a8b44e26f051a51a6db77a3231

I'd prefer a patch that eliminates spurious warnings over one that hides both correct and incorrect warnings. Those using debug level logs to diagnose problems would still see both which is rather unhelpful."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-10-30 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Matt noted in the bug report that __file__ and here are default attributes in PasteDeploy. I think this is otherwise working as expected, as for example I can see delay_auth_decision being set by glance-api. I think it would be safe to just have keystonemiddleware ignore conf[__file__] and conf[here] when validating attributes.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2017-11-01 13:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Colleen The bug report also mentions that panko and gnocchi add "configkey" along with "__file__" and "here". If anyone can insert their own additional keys like this, I don't know that it makes sense for us to code specifically to those keys.

I'll take your word for it that the code is working, but I'm curious as to how that is. It doesn't look right to me...'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-02 07:53:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2017-10-26 06:40:44.000000000', 'message': 'Changed LOG type from warning to debug

There are always going to be some values from config file of all
services that are not relevant from the authtoken middleware
perspective and they will get logged with a warning message which
we need to avoid.

Change-Id: I678482309c7dd35ce147bebf13ebefc84251fe91
Closes-Bug: 1722444

The authtoken middleware has been printing warning log messages to
the API logs for all services, reporting unexpected conf keys. This

Change-Id: I678482309c7dd35ce147bebf13ebefc84251fe91

commit_message:
Expect paste.deploy and gnocchi/panko options

The authtoken middleware has been printing warning log messages to
the API logs for all services, reporting unexpected conf keys. This
was traced back to paste.deploy adding 'here' and '__file__' and
both gnocchi and panko adding 'configkey' keys in wsgi apps though
these do not actually exist in the conf file. This change allows
for those keys without printing a warning that unnecessarily
confuses operators.

But it's kind of a hack, especially the configkey bit. We shouldn't
have to know about gnocchi/panko specifics like this. And it doesn't
address the comment in the bug about what is seen for ironic. So I
think there will still be more to do here.

Change-Id: I678482309c7dd35ce147bebf13ebefc84251fe91
Partial-Bug: 1722444

Need to discuss on IRC meeting..'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-08-03 06:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Many thanks Yushiro for picking the bug up when I was on PTO. I believe on the DVR case we are good for N - S as before. I am still unclear on the HA case with regard to the data path.

What happens with conntrack entries on a switchover with the new ACTIVE that takes over - would like to ascertain the behavior for existing flows. Sorry I am not that familiar with the neutron HA model - @Brian would like ur opinion on this please.  It will give us some direction so we understand the behavior for permitted flows. We are trying to validate as well.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-08-04 18:18:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Sridar, Brian and all,

I tested L3-HA with firewall group with this patch.  I found an issue that if we specify a router port for firewall group, the firewall rule is set into 'standby' router instead of 'active' router.  So, we should determine 'active' router's namespace when we specified L3-HA router port.  Here is a testing log:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/fwaas-l3-ha"}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-08-04 18:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-01 06:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-01 09:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-02 02:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-02 03:19:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Sridar,

Do we need to migrate conntrack entries to new ACTIVE router? According to https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-network-multihost-live-migrate, we don't need to migrate conntrack entires. Do you think so?"}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-10-02 03:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Annp, thanks for your update.  Yes, we don't need to work for migrating conntrack.  Current L3-HA migrate conntrack information."}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-10-02 03:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for your patch.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-02 04:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-02 07:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-05 06:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-05 06:18:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Sridar,

Regards your concern about conntrack. After investigating, conntrack's entries will be sync by L3HA as https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/File:L3_ha_router_failure.png. So existing connection won't disruption."}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-10-11 15:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Currently, firewall rules are applied all of routers(standby, active). My previous testing was bad configuration.  LGTM now.'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port

This commit enables to specify DVR/L3HA port for firewall group. We can
select a port with following device_owner in creating/updating firewall
group.

    * DVR:  'network:router_interface_distributed'
    * L3HA: 'network:ha_router_replicated_interface'

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <annp@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I05f0f652f3e43d5c1ce5ae7933991cf92a418920
Closes-Bug: #1762454

commit_message:
Update unit test debug instructions

Since we've moved to stestr, the test debugging instructions we had
published in our documentation do not actually work anymore. This
updates those instructions to show a couple possible methods that can be
used to perform test debugging.

Change-Id: I9946da0c0d9aa247ff820ee6c02e57bf86a2747d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

May I ask why we need to do the check? And also I noticed that it also adds columns in 112_add_uuid_to_services_table.py etc files, why not adding the check?'}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2018-09-19 07:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* Lenovo-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/lenovo-ci/41/603541/1/Lenovo-FC : SUCCESS in 33:17.37

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi http://54.209.116.144/41/603541/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi/b53e968 : SUCCESS in 1h 44m 24s
- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://54.209.116.144/41/603541/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/c85dd98 : SUCCESS in 1h 38m 30s'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

These are versioned schema migrations, so there is no need to check if a column exists. By definition they will not exist when these migrations are run.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-09-21 02:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-09-21 02:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> May I ask why we need to do the check? And also I noticed that it
 > also adds columns in 112_add_uuid_to_services_table.py etc files,
 > why not adding the check?

We left some placeholders between each version. If the vendors already create the exists column in placeholder, we can skip this.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-09-21 02:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> These are versioned schema migrations, so there is no need to check
 > if a column exists. By definition they will not exist when these
 > migrations are run.

Yep, we left some placeholders between each version. If the vendors already create the exists column in placeholder, we can skip this.

This is the only case I know, So, I add this check in these related scripts.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-25 15:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is pretty standard practice, or it should be, so the schema migrations can be idempotent, e.g.:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604687/4/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/391_add_volume_type_to_bdm.py

Similar to checking of indexes already exist and such.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-28 13:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with Matt, making migrations idempotent sounds like a good idea'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-28 13:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this is unnecessary overhead to support something that is not supported, but I will change my -2 to -1 and let others decide. But placeholder migrations are meant to allow for backporting bug fixes, not to allow vendors to muck with the database schema and make the upstream development make compromises just in case someone somewhere decided to do something that everyone else needs to be concerned about.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-10-10 01:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Meh.

Though I do feel I need to point out that "If the vendors already create the exists column in placeholder" is not the intended use for the placeholders.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:09:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

But I also don't think LisaLi's question was answered about why not to do the check for all cases."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-10-11 02:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> But I also don't think LisaLi's question was answered about why not
 > to do the check for all cases.

Lisa means we only added the exist check in 112_add_uuid_to_services_table.py, but not added in other migration scripts (which are added in this patch).


And I check again using:

grep  ".create_column(" cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/*

commit_message:
Don't sent disk_over_commit if nova api > 2.24

In API microversion 2.25 Nova removed the disk_over_commit parameter
to the live migration server action. This patch makes sure that we
don't include it in our request if we're running with 2.25 or higher.

Story: #2002963
Task: #22966
Change-Id: I1bbdd33be96d82422a05982508e370237c3560f3
(cherry picked from commit d6121782d3aa6a95b883220b27a154e641b61f7f)

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I74031a2bcafda1a24d7c767218a3b050ae63bc46
(cherry picked from commit 0b6f76e22c975e855def7dc6e1286f5a979de4bb)

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I9ab81228a29133e7f50629db3b604eeab6bedf5a
(cherry picked from commit 441c8b6b819b85b81989499bffda09a04e2ec612)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 03:31:25.000000000', 'message': "Improve debug msg

The msg of VolumePathsNotFound exception should contain more infos in
connection_properties, likes 'target_wwns' and 'target_luns'. In this
case we can just provide the connection_properties.

Change-Id: Id787809161e2125393bf4fe303b5bc0a8d92c2e4
"}, {'created': '2018-10-08 02:56:57.000000000', 'message': "Improve VolumePathsNotFound message details

The msg of VolumePathsNotFound exception should contain more info in
connection_properties, like 'target_wwns' and 'target_luns'. In this
case we provide 'target_wwn', 'target_wwns', 'target_lun' and
'target_luns' in this exception.

Change-Id: Id787809161e2125393bf4fe303b5bc0a8d92c2e4
"}, {'created': '2018-10-09 03:23:03.000000000', 'message': "Improve VolumePathsNotFound message details

The msg of VolumePathsNotFound exception should contain more info in
connection_properties, like 'target_wwns' and 'target_luns'. In this
case we provide the summary info 'luns' and 'wwns' instead.

Change-Id: Id787809161e2125393bf4fe303b5bc0a8d92c2e4
"}]
commit_message:
Improve VolumePathsNotFound message details

The msg of VolumePathsNotFound exception should contain more info in
connection_properties, like 'target_wwns' and 'target_luns'. In this
case we provide the summary info 'luns' and 'wwns' instead.

Change-Id: Id787809161e2125393bf4fe303b5bc0a8d92c2e4

commit_message:
Update repo_build SHA for virtualenv creation fix

To ensure that https://review.openstack.org/612640 is included
in the next release, we update the role requirements file.

Without that fix, any re-run of the repo-build playbook after
the first one will fail.

Change-Id: Ie9419be3e5738eeb1c4c6bb444a870a0efa45fd8

commit_message:
Ensure namespace and network policy compatibility

This patch ensures namespace handler does not depend on specific
functions implemented on the security group driver for the namespace
isolation. This way it will be possible to enable the namespace
handler (to create a different network per namespace) together with
the network policy that will perform the isolation between pods/svc
in a different way.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Closes-Bug: #1799496
Change-Id: Ied892e616075ce16fdc15ceb31219c100e011536

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I1ae15cabb5df513c7660825404327b8628b9ba2e
(cherry picked from commit a50476d6de74e6089985701e30f013b1b198de22)

commit_message:
Bump os-brick version to 2.6.1

This will get us bug fixes for gate bug:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1732199

and another bug that looks like it could affect the gate:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1794829

Closes-Bug: #1732199

Change-Id: I709b4a1438aedcfc95d191462b4ec3f1f8c4355a

commit_message:
Fixes Python3 issue in decoding password

The 'nova get-password' command shows a passowrd as bytes
instead of string in Python 3 currently.
It should be shown as string.
So fix it.

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ibcfb071fcc3c74535b800295ec95ca5ec8bc3c9b
Closes-Bug: #1794167

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 17:44:43.000000000', 'message': 'py3 ldap does not allow bytes for DN/RDN/field names

In Python 3, python-ldap does not allow bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Update ldappool to adhere to this behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I9ef10432229aaffe4ac9bd733d608098cdae3b9a
Partial-Bug: #1798184
'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 13:52:46.000000000', 'message': 'PY3: switch to using unicode text values

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Instead, text values are represented as str, the Unicode
text type.

This patch updates the keystone LDAP backend to adhere to this
behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I9ef10432229aaffe4ac9bd733d608098cdae3b9a
Partial-Bug: #1798184
'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 13:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'PY3: switch to using unicode text values

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Instead, text values are represented as str, the Unicode
text type.

This patch updates the code to adhere to this behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I9ef10432229aaffe4ac9bd733d608098cdae3b9a
Partial-Bug: #1798184
'}]
commit_message:
PY3: switch to using unicode text values

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Instead, text values are represented as str, the Unicode
text type.

This patch updates the code to adhere to this behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I9ef10432229aaffe4ac9bd733d608098cdae3b9a
Partial-Bug: #1798184

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: If2a401e444df982c3cd79a3f2d591438f3582c2a
(cherry picked from commit 934727a3e05db6dacb656a461fe9be9054c3a753)

commit_message:
Increase the deploy_plan timeout in tripleoclient

The time for the deploy workflow to complete has been creeping up, and
it is getting close to the 6 minute timeout in the client. This bumps
the timeout to 10 minutes.

Change-Id: Iadb7cc9ba3b62a0221109b1dacf2d764944f691a
Related-Bug: #1789680

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: Iab5c434cd40b909b8b43f52cd9f50cae83c1c715
(cherry picked from commit 0aed681fb8974c3575e9a645e2731088940ddca1)

commit_message:
DNM: Enable macspoofing tempest test

This test was disabled because it expects dhcp interface to be
present. Now that we have metadata enabled by default it should
pass.

Also execute those tests marked as 'slow' to check if this test
passes.

Change-Id: I3c2279c93b5aea8bec389b1ca5bed6c3f0fe590c

commit_message:
DNM: Test OVS 2.9 with Port Groups backport

This patch disables OVN metadata service as well to be able to compare
rally results against ML2/OVS since OVN metadata service creates an
extra port upon network creation.

Change-Id: I93b53f83b956a4b6bc02b32a6f509a25b53a7aea

[{'created': '2018-01-21 10:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'delete_flows shall only touch flows with the bridge cookie

With this change delete_flows will only remove flows matching the default
cookie of the bridge.

The uninstall_flows implementation in the native bridge is also modified
to touch only the flows with the bridge cookie.

To still allow deletion of all cookies, cookie=COOKIE_ANY is introduced
as a special value, and used in the agent code in the places where the
intent is indeed to clean all flows whatever their cookie is.

Partial-Bug: #1739411
(cherry picked from commit d761d26225a8fc63e512fc26b864a46c0956e19a)
Change-Id: Idd0531cedda87224531cb8fb6a912ccd0f1554d5
'}]
commit_message:
delete_flows shall only touch flows with the bridge cookie

With this change delete_flows will only remove flows matching the default
cookie of the bridge.

The uninstall_flows implementation in the native bridge is also modified
to touch only the flows with the bridge cookie.

To still allow deletion of all cookies, cookie=COOKIE_ANY is introduced
as a special value, and used in the agent code in the places where the
intent is indeed to clean all flows whatever their cookie is.

Partial-Bug: #1739411
(cherry picked from commit d761d26225a8fc63e512fc26b864a46c0956e19a)
Change-Id: Idd0531cedda87224531cb8fb6a912ccd0f1554d5

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: Ic23a77d8f88ed890a219c410d37a94bd97037c53
(cherry picked from commit 6509751e13f09a6a58f1348101caca5a60280191)

Small stuffs.

Out of curiosity I ran:

   ./tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py --template ./ci/environments/network/public-bond/nic-configs/controller.yaml --tht-dir ./ --roles-data ./roles_data.yaml -n ./network_data.yaml 

And noticed that the controller.yaml got all its {get_param: ...} changed to "get_param:..." (without the bracket).

Maybe it's not meant to be used that way, but I just wanted to mention it in case it's meaningful.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > Small stuffs.
 > 
 > Out of curiosity I ran:
 > 
 > ./tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py --template
 > ./ci/environments/network/public-bond/nic-configs/controller.yaml
 > --tht-dir ./ --roles-data ./roles_data.yaml -n ./network_data.yaml
 > 
 > And noticed that the controller.yaml got all its {get_param: ...}
 > changed to "get_param:..." (without the bracket).
 > 
 > Maybe it's not meant to be used that way, but I just wanted to
 > mention it in case it's meaningful.

This is because the yaml dumper uses a different style. For example::

Instead of:
  dns_servers: {get_param: DnsServers}

We get:
  dns_servers:
    get_param: DnsServers

The two above are interpreted identical when the yaml is later loaded, so this is not a problem.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Thanks Harald, this latest patchset addresses all of my concerns.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-24 22:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Harald, yprokule found no issue with it neither.  Let's merge this."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 617bc441d1bb06f8e70672c8cf913517da4c45b8'}]

commit_message:
Merge new params - nic-config templates

Utility script to merge new parameters into existing nic-config
templates. Uses process-templates.py rendered 'single-nic-vlans'
templates as reference and appends any parameters that is not
already present in the existing NIC template.

New NIC template parameters were introduced in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580236/

When upgrading the existing NIC templates have to have these
new parameters merged.

Change-Id: I474e57878212d2cb7c2b392a5fdf4e449f783a66

commit_message:
Add support for UDP protocols in Octavia OVN Driver

This patch adds support for UDP protocol. It however also introduces
a limitation. Currently OVN flows are configured such that LBs can
support only a single protocol. Therefore, an LB can be configured
to use only UDP or only TCP.
The protocol in the LB is set by the FIRST Listener associated with
it.
This patch allows pools to also have UDP protocol.
Partial-Bug: #1789157
Change-Id: I1fa13dfbd165f470bfc0b83222bdec36edf70f94

commit_message:
Delete administrator federation guide

The federated-identity guide in the admin section is out of date
relative to the one in the operator section. It is sort of incoherent
and the information within it that is valuable is already present in the
other guide. Delete this guide in favor of just promoting the operator
guide.

Related-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I8c0190725d0f7297957bbf10fd9d7184e52ff5f3

commit_message:
Make Queens and Rocky share same conf template

The original patch for this bug fied the problem for
rocky only but queens also suffers from the same
problem. Since the only diff between the P and R
templates is this change, move it into Q so that
Q and R will both get the fix.

Change-Id: I69eb59d324cb04481e6eb76e7759e406a96d6700
Related-Bug: #1788631

This commit removes the release parameter from the exaple commands
related to STONITH, the parameter is not requested, not needed and may
confuse users.

commit_message:
Add heat results inside log files

This commit simplifies the way logs are generated, removing the split
between stdout and stderr and adding also the logs for the heat actions,
so that analyzing failures should become easier.

Change-Id: Ic1d150d5d67a1c22ce8a3bb6951265a8c9b94f27

For upgrade checks and so on, I suggest that this check function should be added to freezer-api project.'}, {'account_id': 19098, 'date': '2018-10-26 02:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:45:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add freezer-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for freezer-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I49155c9ceaef13a83ea10566eca97139d806dada
Story: 2003657
Task: 26129

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 15:56:00.000000000', 'message': "Replace openSUSE experimental check with newer version

We're migrating now to openSUSE 15.0 (yes, 15.0 is newer than 42.3),
remove legacy job and replace with native Zuul v3 job running python3.

Change-Id: If7e1b1108acb7a7f8b6b7524213ba5dae5560b53
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609359
"}]
commit_message:
Replace openSUSE experimental check with newer version

We're migrating now to openSUSE 15.0 (yes, 15.0 is newer than 42.3),
remove legacy job and replace with native Zuul v3 job running python3.

Change-Id: If7e1b1108acb7a7f8b6b7524213ba5dae5560b53
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609359

subject: Added support for installing tempest from distro

 > variables set for each particular distro?

for each distro, It will be auto handled here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591424/3/tasks/install/distro.yml@19

'}, {'created': '2018-08-16 08:01:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Unifing tempest role for Tripleo

* Added support for installing tempest from RPM
* generate tempest.conf using python-tempestconf
TODO:
* Fix tempest run
* Subunit file generation

Change-Id: Ie280cfa6b93fa65c56ed98066deb4f9c82a1a8db
'}, {'created': '2018-10-02 08:03:42.000000000', 'message': 'Added support for installing tempest from distro

In order to consume os_tempest role across different deployment
tools, following changes are introduced:
- tempest_install_method:distro|source through which user can install
  tempest from source as well as distro
- tempest_workspace directory is added as when tempest is installed

'}, {'created': '2018-10-25 14:27:44.000000000', 'message': 'Added support for installing tempest from distro

In order to consume os_tempest role across different deployment
tools, following changes are introduced:
- tempest_install_method:distro|source through which user can install
  tempest from source as well as distro
- tempest_workspace directory is added as when tempest is installed
  from distro, we need a place where tempest can be executed. It
  generalised the use of tempest_workspace at each place.
- The default location of the default tempest configuration is now
 /etc/tempest/tempest.conf rather than the previous default of
  $HOME/.tempest/etc.

Change-Id: Ie280cfa6b93fa65c56ed98066deb4f9c82a1a8db

commit_message:
Added support for installing tempest from distro

In order to consume os_tempest role across different deployment
tools, following changes are introduced:
- tempest_install_method:distro|source through which user can install
  tempest from source as well as distro
- tempest_workspace directory is added as when tempest is installed
  from distro, we need a place where tempest can be executed. It
  generalised the use of tempest_workspace at each place.
- The default location of the default tempest configuration is now
 /etc/tempest/tempest.conf rather than the previous default of
  $HOME/.tempest/etc.

Change-Id: Ie280cfa6b93fa65c56ed98066deb4f9c82a1a8db

commit_message:
Allow streaming raw partition images

Currently we support streaming raw whole disk images, but not
partition ones. This change enables it.

Change-Id: Ie95102aa3f2054a6b429f3d3e0926e90923c5faf
Story: #2003809
Task: #26558

commit_message:
Add routes and multi-vif resources to Kuryr's CR

This commit adds routes and network-attachment-definitions resources to
kuryr-controller ClusterRole. Without that we wouldn't be able to access
them though ServiceAccount token, so features depending on those
wouldn't be working in containerized deployments.

Change-Id: Ifd0322b0ec7951d281fdae6e9e08c4356177b06d
Partial-Bug: 1796122
(cherry picked from commit 81b953be94b93d8b736b97b3cea85857e92d9958)

commit_message:
Use octavia_service_setup_host for getting facts

When trying to retrieve the facts, it attempts to run this on
the remote system which no longer ships or has any OpenStack
clients on it.

Change-Id: I2531775a7bfa6b526b5190c651844c0bbd08a1f0

commit_message:
Move KUBERNETES_NODE_NAME env var to controller

KUBERNETES_NODE_NAME environment variable was defined in kuryr-daemon
DaemonSet instead of in kuryr-controller's Deployment. As it's only used
by kuryr-controller, this commit moves that definition to its correct
place.

Change-Id: Idec2961e6c820524290a20655930a2bfd2898621
Closes-Bug: 1798835

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input
method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: Ia7da4523e726db04f85b1ebd49bf5ec4e31fe727
Closes-Bug: #1792131
(cherry picked from commit 72bbe3eef513a34b066bfb3ccf22287197c3d027)

commit_message:
Add bionic py3 test and switch linters/integrated to bionic

As we switch Stein towards being primarily tested via bionic,
we add a py3 job for bionic, switch the linters test to use
bionic and finally switch the integrated experimental job to
use bionic instead of xenial.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613030
Change-Id: I80ed525d759d316620c77b688469aeedc13692bc

commit_message:
Use consistent apt options for upgrades

The 'apt-get upgrade' does not set confdef and confold currently, so an
upgrade which requires user input can break the cache build[1].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/733076/

Change-Id: Ic6689387a28539b7eb341d55a9db08f078e8e975

commit_message:
Clean up unused upgrade test tooling

It has been discussed and decided at the last two PTG's
that upgrade testing in roles is broken in the current
state and that we need to make use of the integrated
repo for upgrade tests. As such these old tools are no
longer required.

Change-Id: I46756bc0db6baa9487dffccce3e64cd5d035fd3c

subject: Add disk and container format to image task test
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 15:04:23.000000000', 'message': "Add disk and container format to image task test

We had a regression in the latest release of openstacksdk that was due
to sending disk_format and container_format in the update properties
call after creating the image with tasks.

Add disk_format and container_format arguments so that we can ensure
they don't get sent.

Change-Id: I276433591a90ec38b9b0a6f3fd62297ac02f3793
"}]
commit_message:
Add disk and container format to image task test

We had a regression in the latest release of openstacksdk that was due
to sending disk_format and container_format in the update properties
call after creating the image with tasks.

Add disk_format and container_format arguments so that we can ensure
they don't get sent.

commit_message:
Add memcache flushing handler on db migrations

Flushing cache when schema changes occur to avoid drift between
what might be cached and what keystone queries expect.

Given that this is a workaround which is only usually required
in major upgrades (and should really be handled in process by
keystone itself), we make the execution optional so that it can
be set to happen only on major upgrades.

To prevent test breakage as happened in master, we combine the
two master patches into one for the backport:

https://review.openstack.org/608066
https://review.openstack.org/613256

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613292
Change-Id: Ibf8f3dd60d6f3c446a14dc8228fa005f12fcc840
Closes-Bug: 1793389

[{'created': '2018-10-25 07:43:35.000000000', 'message': '[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)
'}]
commit_message:
[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)

commit_message:
Add memcache flushing handler on db migrations

Flushing cache when schema changes occur to avoid drift between
what might be cached and what keystone queries expect.

Given that this is a workaround which is only usually required
in major upgrades (and should really be handled in process by
keystone itself), we make the execution optional so that it can
be set to happen only on major upgrades.

To prevent test breakage as happened in master, we combine the
two master patches into one for the backport:

https://review.openstack.org/608066
https://review.openstack.org/613256

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613293
Change-Id: Ibf8f3dd60d6f3c446a14dc8228fa005f12fcc840
Closes-Bug: 1793389

commit_message:
Follow-up to 27c725c to move up ``cache_clear``

Move up ``cache_clear()`` to ``ResourceBase._do_refresh()``
method. It saves on a lot of ``_do_refresh()`` overrides in
subclasses.

Also change to ``Sequence`` (from ``Iterable``) in the caching
implementation.

Follow-up of Change: I7404a15beb029cb282ac6b84bb8b8fdb97ebcd4c

Change-Id: Id6c6afcd9142bed0a7f59b9f8893fb86975a65bb

commit_message:
Include local_ip & undercloud_admin_host in docker_insecure_registries

This patch includes by default the local_ip and undercloud_admin_host in
docker_insecure_registries parameter, that can be missed but actually
needed in some cases.

This code was done in tripleoclient for the containerized undercloud in
Rocky, so we just need to port it here for stable versions, to have the
same behavior.

Change-Id: I03be8381ec776fd769139c79b85470acedc64d2b
Closes-Bug: #1799784

commit_message:
SUSE: Fix version compare for OBS containers repository

Right now the OBS:Virtualization:containers repository is added to Leap
15 because the version comparison does not quite work. We need to use the
'version' test to properly compare distribution versions.

Change-Id: Ib2b8e8b41ad34daf387d2bfb0c7308c271570f21

subject: Support passing adapter to adapter
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-09-05 13:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-09-12 20:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

am actual better way might be to pass the adapter instance to the adapter class, so that any other client that has a SessionClient based on adapter.Adapter can be instantiated from config like:

  s = loading.load_session_from_conf_options(conf)
  a = loading.load_adapter_from_conf_options(session=s)
  client = someclient.Client(adapter=a)'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-09-14 17:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-09-17 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck

by the looks of it the failed test is due to job or test timeout'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-19 07:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-19 09:39:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763410

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-10-17 03:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

pls,fix the confict'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:55:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There's a thing we do in openstacksdk that might be useful to do here - which is that we support setting an AdapterClass in openstack.config.CloudRegion, so that cloud_region.get_session_client (which returns an adapter based on the config) will use the passed in class's constructor instead.

SO - we could align this usecase with that pattern and add a parameter to load_adapter_from_conf instead ... so you could do:

client = load_adapter_from_conf(plugin_class=someclient.Client)

while we're going down that road though - I'll argue that:

- load_adapter_from_conf() should also take a session argument, so that you can do:

  session = load_session_from_conf()
  client = load_adapter_from_conf(
      session=session, plugin_class=someclient.Client)

But honestly - now we're getting in to duplicating sdk layer stuff.

So instead - what if we add load_from_conf methods to sdk (which we need to do anyway for the services that are using sdk already like heat and senlin) - then just use those facilities. So like this:

  cloud_region = openstack.config.load_from_conf()
  client = cloud_region.get_session_client(
      adapter_class=someclient.Client)

That would also let the CloudRegion object handle creating Session and passing it to the Adapter constructor properly."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-19 17:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

I very much agree with Monty's comment and that we should be adding the functionality to SDK. Ideally the python-*client libaries should all go away long term, and everyone lean exclusively on SDK. If code in SDK helps us get there, we should do it that way.

If layering into SDK is not enough, we can add the similar bits that monty proposed into KSA.

I'll reconsider the -2 if we need to push the changes down instead of loading into SDK."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-10-26 11:56:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

will explore Monty's proposal, like it more indeed"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 13:03:05.000000000', 'message': 'Allow loading custom adapters from config

many clients implement their session clients as subclasses of
`adapter.Adapter` to add some logic for custom headers etc.
This makes it hard to instantiate those clients
directly from config as one has to load `adapter.Adapter` from config,
decompose it to kwargs and pass those to client.

This patch makes it possible to pass an `adapter` kwarg to
`adapter.load_from_conf_options`, which will use the provided class as
plugin to load instead of `adapter.Adapter` (default).

Change-Id: I8daa94a245e68a62e48f068c09b64223ab751d8e
'}, {'created': '2018-09-14 17:17:24.000000000', 'message': 'Support passing adapter to adapter

many clients implement their session clients as subclasses of
`adapter.Adapter` to add some logic for custom headers etc.
This makes it hard to instantiate those clients having an adapter
loaded from config as one has to decompose it to kwargs before passing those
to client.

This patch makes an `adapter.Adapter` to accept an optional `adapter`
argument that will be used to set all the adapter-related options that
could be loaded from config if their correspoonding explicit arguments
were not set.

This will make it possible to create clients like

  session = load_session_from_conf()
  adapter = load_adapter_from_conf()
  client = someclient.Client(session, adapter=adapter)

Change-Id: I8daa94a245e68a62e48f068c09b64223ab751d8e
'}]
commit_message:
Support passing adapter to adapter

many clients implement their session clients as subclasses of
`adapter.Adapter` to add some logic for custom headers etc.
This makes it hard to instantiate those clients having an adapter
loaded from config as one has to decompose it to kwargs before passing those
to client.

This patch makes an `adapter.Adapter` to accept an optional `adapter`
argument that will be used to set all the adapter-related options that
could be loaded from config if their correspoonding explicit arguments
were not set.

This will make it possible to create clients like

  session = load_session_from_conf()
  adapter = load_adapter_from_conf()
  client = someclient.Client(session, adapter=adapter)

Change-Id: I8daa94a245e68a62e48f068c09b64223ab751d8e

commit_message:
Disable sending metrics for clusters

There is a reported issue in Magnum which makes clusters fail
to provision if the cluster stat reporting is enabled with
Kuberentes 4.0.0

This patch disables it as the recommended workaround until this
is resolved upstream.

Change-Id: I91d4873d94ce85a0768c441df9e0701da1706115
(cherry picked from commit 0d5a2e1d77f7d2e7302de66e9f5b76c6fe7f827c)

commit_message:
Use keystone_auth for credentials

Magnum requires credentials to be stored inside keystone_auth
in order to be able to properly talk to other services.  This
patch addresses that and moves those settings in the right place.

Change-Id: I8e8b3f769ae58aa8d7ceb22eaf264865790afeed
(cherry picked from commit abf2d03b5b4be2d5257804f3d768d56823e2bb6e)

commit_message:
Define OSH_PATH by default

OSH_PATH is not defined by default outside OpenStack's CI.

This is a problem if a user wants to run scripts manually on its
machine for local testing.

This fixes it by having, by default, the OSH_PATH defined
in the scripts using OSH relatively to current folder.

For user experience, the script returns to the same path after
running.

Change-Id: I915e7d3c945f2002a2008b2b033a2b7725320b17

commit_message:
Use global-requirements for requirements

This updates cloudkittyclient's requirement files in order to use
openstack/requirements for constraints. This will help to avoid dependency
conflicts when cloudkittyclient is deployed in an openstack context.

Work items:

* Updated requirements.txt, test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt
  with the `update-requirements` tool provided by openstack/requirements.

* Added a lower-constraints.txt file.

* Added the "check-requirements" zuul job template to the CI.

Change-Id: I12a882ce4d24ade153a64b75852396377ac42ca6

subject: Change netcat to be a required package
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-25 11:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-10-25 19:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-10-26 10:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 11:58:40.000000000', 'message': 'Change netcat to be a required package

Netcat is not a direct dependancy of memcached nor the playbooks in
this role, however other OSA roles delegate tasks to the memcached
container and run shell commands which use nc.

This patch ensures that netcat is explicity installed into the
memcached container and we do not rely on it being present in the
container base image.

Given that the memcached_test_distro_packages variable is no longer
used, the associated bits for it are also removed.

Change-Id: Id046aa97ed90654f1859e584891fe5228f96aa90
(cherry picked from commit 261db5b8837e078f7880f9fac562b93467384b6d)
'}]
commit_message:
Change netcat to be a required package

Netcat is not a direct dependancy of memcached nor the playbooks in
this role, however other OSA roles delegate tasks to the memcached
container and run shell commands which use nc.

This patch ensures that netcat is explicity installed into the
memcached container and we do not rely on it being present in the
container base image.

Given that the memcached_test_distro_packages variable is no longer
used, the associated bits for it are also removed.

Change-Id: Id046aa97ed90654f1859e584891fe5228f96aa90
(cherry picked from commit 261db5b8837e078f7880f9fac562b93467384b6d)

(cherry picked from commit 261db5b8837e078f7880f9fac562b93467384b6d)

commit_message:
Change netcat to be a required package

Netcat is not a direct dependancy of memcached nor the playbooks in
this role, however other OSA roles delegate tasks to the memcached
container and run shell commands which use nc.

This patch ensures that netcat is explicity installed into the
memcached container and we do not rely on it being present in the
container base image.

Given that the memcached_test_distro_packages variable is no longer
used, the associated bits for it are also removed.

Change-Id: Id046aa97ed90654f1859e584891fe5228f96aa90
(cherry picked from commit 261db5b8837e078f7880f9fac562b93467384b6d)

[{'created': '2018-10-03 15:10:37.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: limit Failover Cluster WMI provider usage

The Failover Cluster WMI provider is quite unreliable, especially
in recent Windows Server 2016 versions.

After failovers, some valid WMI queries fail with "Invalid Property"
errors, which really looks like a WMI provider bug. Event listeners
are affected as well, for which reason we're missing VM failover events.

This change refactors "clusterutils", switching to the underlying
C library.

The new failover event listener cannot provide the source of the
migrated instances, so we're keeping the old one as well for backwards
compatibility, for now.

The only other place in which we're still using WMI is the method that
adds VM cluster roles. The reason is that we'd have to explicitly
create the the cluster resources and group, probably set some
resource dependencies and properties. For now, it's easier/safer to
just stick with the WMI method (which really shouldn't fail).

Change-Id: I63d1aa3a6f9fb12d08478eb41fe973b1582b540c

commit_message:
Limit Failover Cluster WMI provider usage

The Failover Cluster WMI provider is quite unreliable, especially
in recent Windows Server 2016 versions.

After failovers, some valid WMI queries fail with "Invalid Property"
errors, which really looks like a WMI provider bug. Event listeners
are affected as well, for which reason we're missing VM failover events.

This change refactors "clusterutils", switching to the underlying
C library.

The new failover event listener cannot provide the source of the
migrated instances, so we're keeping the old one as well for backwards
compatibility, for now.

The only other places in which we're still using WMI are the methods
that add or destroy VM cluster roles.

The reason is that we'd have to explicitly create the the cluster
resources and group, probably set some resource dependencies and
properties. For now, it's easier/safer to just stick with the WMI
method (which really shouldn't fail).

Also, destroying VM cluster groups using clusapi's DestroyClusterGroup
function behaves strange. VMs get recreated asyncronuously and put in
suspended state, breaking everything. We're avoiding it for now.

Closes-Bug: #1798069

Change-Id: I63d1aa3a6f9fb12d08478eb41fe973b1582b540c

Fix the code that enforces the image volume cache max size and max count
limits so that each limit functions independently from the other.

commit_message:
Fix image volume cache max size and max count limits

Fix the code that enforces the image volume cache max size and max count
limits so that each limit functions independently from the other.

This fixes a bug where the code would function correctly when both were
set to zero (unlimited) or when both limits were set (non-zero), but would
misbehave when only one limit was set and the other unlimited.

Closes-Bug: #1792944
Change-Id: I8b4843c2e9392139b42d6e2ebd2c5e1cd09d4c7a
(cherry picked from commit 74249de6398dbec8592591667b83a5612bf4a969)
(cherry picked from commit 4c2b41d5b531c1e3cd87172d30f280f89e2505a3)
(cherry picked from commit fe0c082529c301e28fd7dd517f564eaaed944475)

Change-Id: Ife232ce16008be8eabef9efc8f46465c2ab8e7ad
'}]
commit_message:
Example setup for gnocchi with ceph and redis

This doc explains how to setup gnocchi with:
- ceph as metric storage
- redis as measure stroage
- zookeeper for coordination

Change-Id: Ife232ce16008be8eabef9efc8f46465c2ab8e7ad

commit_message:
Use consistent apt options for upgrades

The 'apt-get upgrade' does not set confdef and confold currently, so an
upgrade which requires user input can break the cache build[1].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/733076/

Change-Id: Ic6689387a28539b7eb341d55a9db08f078e8e975
